texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “FUXION”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Srta. Deyra ella es soltera  tiene 23 años de edad; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de vitaminas para las distintas personas que le soliciten como amistades, familiares entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de vitaminas para su negocio.
Los otros socios  se dedican a la construcción civil, redes de mercadeo, notaria, venta de vitaminas y trabajadores de hoteles.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The Fuxion community bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is in the province and department of Cusco.  

Deyra is a member of the group.  She is 23 years old.  She balances her daily activities with her business selling vitamins to the different people who order them, such as friends and family.  She is having a good time with her business, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts in every day.  Deyra is a responsible person who wants to continue working to improve life for her family.

She is requesting this loan to purchase vitamins for her business.  The other group members work in civil construction, trade networks, as a notary, selling vitamins, and as hotel workers.  

The group members are grateful to everyone who is part of this dream and promise to make their repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Matwopig Group

texts.en: Christine (pictured raising her hand) is 52 years old and lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is married with nine children and runs a poultry farm alongside earning a salary to boost her income. She sells her produce to hotels and local people in the vicinity. Her dream is to expand her business and have a bigger clientele base, although stiff competition and poultry diseases are her major setbacks. Christine intends to use the loan to buy more poultry feed. She is a member of the above mentioned group, in which each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Rechie

texts.en:
Rechie is 43 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rechie has been raising pigs for nine years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Rechie is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Chukuriemeka

texts.fr: Afin d’acheter des sacs d’écoliers et de voyage pour revendre au marché, Chukuriemeka âgé de 34ans est célibataire et sans enfant. Démarré l’activité en 2003, il s’y plait bien car cela lui procure des revenus lui permettant de se prendre en charge et de faire accroitre son activité. Les objectifs fixés par ce client actif est de se marier et d’agrandir son activité c’est pour cela, elle sollicite ce troisième prêt pour s’approvisionner en marchandises.
texts.en:
Chukuriemeka is a 34-year-old single man, with no children, who wants to buy school bags and travel bags to resell at the market.  He started in this business in 2003.  He likes his job, since it brings an income which allows him to support himself and to increase his activity.

Chukuriemeka ia a very active client, whose goals are to get married and to expand his business.  He is therefore requesting this third loan to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy school bags and travel bags.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel sells kerosene in Nairobi and has been in the business for five years. He is 41-years-old, married and has three children. He currently earns a monthly income of 18,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

This is Samuel's first loan and he plans to buy kerosene stock to sell. He will use the income he generates to educate his children and open another kerosene sales business.

Samuel hopes to grow his business and earn more income so that he can build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy stock of kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 60 years old and married with eleven children. She works hard to provide for her family and runs a general store in the Philippines. Thus, she has requested a 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Herminia has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 51 years old and married.  She has six children. Corazon works very hard to provide for them.

Corazon runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, soap, sugar and other groceries. 

Corazon requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

In the future Corazon would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 49 years old and married. She has five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlita has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Merlita is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

Nelly has been in this business for 20 years. Nelly earns additional income from raising livestock and farming rice.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 57 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Charito has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. 

Charito requested a 18,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to resell. In the future, Charito would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to resell.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette works hard to support her family. Suzette is married and has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years.

Suzette requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

In the future, Suzette would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle transport.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo a 52ans et est veuve. Elle a en charge des enfants. Pour améliorer les conditions de vie de ses derniers, elle revend des condiments (légumes et des épices). Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et expose ses différents produits à la devanture de sa maison. Le prêt sollicité l’aidera à aider ses enfants et faire développer ses activités.
texts.en: Adjo is a 52-year-old widow who has some children in her care.  In order to improve the children's living conditions, she resells condiments (vegetables and spices).  She buys her goods at the Grand Market in Lomé and displays her various products in front of her house.  The loan that she is requesting will help allow her to support her children and develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is farmer in Tala, where she plants vegetables, maize, potatoes and tomatoes, which she sells. She also rears dairy cows and sells milk to dairy shops. Lucia has been in the farming business for two years and currently earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

This will be Lucia's second loan and she plans to buy vegetable seedlings, which she can plant in her farm. Lucia also plans to buy more feed for her cows. She will use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and also to pay for electricity installation in her home.

Lucia hopes to grow her farming business and become one of the best farmers in the area.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and cow feed.

loans.name: Ida

texts.en:
Ida is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

Ida is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Ida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production.

loans.name: Felicitee

texts.en: Felicitee is 31 years old. She sells utensils and has been in the business for the past nine years. She also sells saucepans. She plans to use the loan to buy more inventory. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more sauce pans and other utensils to sell.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 60 years old and married with five children. Nena works very hard to provide for them.

Nena runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

Nena has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, fruits, vegetables and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Nena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 35 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She completed 12th grade. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

For the past five years, she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother.

She sells six days a week from 7 A.M. to 5 P.M. She uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her business spot. She likes her business because customers buy from her.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is from Meghri town where she lives with her husband and her twin son and daughter.
 
Together with her husband, Karine started to raise cattle several years ago. Now they keep on their farm four cows. Karine milks the cows and gets dairy products, which are sold locally. 

Karine's husband works at a local company and his salary is hardly enough for covering the family's basic needs. Realizing that agriculture helps them to have a stable income and having a good credit history behind her, Karine has requested this loan.

With the loan's help, she plans to purchase three more cows and increase her dairy production.

Karine is sure that this loan will help her to increase the profit of her family and ensure a better life for them.

loans.use: to pay for three cows.

loans.name: Tioumoutie 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe TIOUMOUTIE 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à ZIASSO, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mme NATOGOMA debout en première  position de la gauche vers la droite. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les intrants et semences agricoles pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 105.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the TIOUMOUTIE 4 group are married women who are, on average, 43 years old with four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Ziasso, one of the villages of the Sikasso region (third-largest administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their ninth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Natogoma, a member of the group, grows maize. In the photo, she is in the standing row, first from the left.

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds in order to cultivate 0.5 hectare (1.23 acre) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production at her village market to both men and women. She is expecting to make a profit of 105,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is 36 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Benita has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. 

Benita requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

In the future, Benita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Apporinaire

texts.en: Apporinaire is 48 years old. He is married with three children. He sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for two years. With the loan, he would like to buy more bananas and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to increase his savings.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is 32 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a variety store in the Philippines. In order to purchase more stock to sell, she has requested a 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF.

Ma. Gina has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for three years and also earns an income from rice retailing. She aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store.

loans.name: Veteliana

texts.en:
Veteliana works hard to support her family. Veteliana is married and has a basket weaving business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for two years now.

Veteliana has requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Veteliana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Valens

texts.en: Valens is 40 years old. He owns a store where different beers are sold. With the loan, he wants to buy more beers and sodas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more beers and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 44 years old and married with one kid.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Jonah is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jonah has been farming rice for twenty years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 27 years old. She sells vegetables and has been in the business for the past three years. With the loan, she wants to buy more vegetables to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Trinity Wome's Group

texts.en:
Jaliah is a farmer. She also operates a retail shop in Lyantonde town to supplement her income so that she can adequately meet the needs of her family, since she is a single mother.

She wants to grow vegetables so that she can sell them to the people in town, since there is ready market. She does not have the time, however,  but she feels that if she hired someone, he would do a good job in a very short time. 

Therefore, the loan will help her with hiring the labour as well as buying seeds and pesticides. She is a hard working and innovative woman who encourages other women to be innovative.

(The eighth person on the right is the Ugafode staff member.)

loans.use: To buy seeds and hire labour to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Sua

texts.en:
Sua is 52 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is a widow, and when she was younger was unable to go to school.  She has five children aged between 19 and 28. 

Sua has described herself as a hard-working woman; for the past twelve years she has been selling cold water in the local market.  She sells water six days per week from 10am to 4pm.  She likes her business because of the way customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her children. She uses a shared-taxi every day to get her goods to her business spot.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cold water for her business with the profits from her business she plans to build a house for her children.  She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more cold water for her business.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a 48-years-old woman who lives in the West point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has three children aged  between 28 and 14. Only one is  in school and two of her children live at home. She described herself as a hardworking woman.

For the past 6 years she has been selling charcoal in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7AM to 4PM. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her children's father. She uses shared-taxi every time to get her goods to her business spot.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She plans is to build a house for her children. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Riziki Group

texts.fr: La cliente Matabishi est leader du groupe d’affaire  « Riziki», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 35 ans, divorcée et mère de 2 enfants qui étudient tous. La cliente est vendeuse des souliers usagers. Elle installe ses articles au marché public et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son ex mari, Il y a environ 11 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 3 ballons de souliers. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et acheter une parcelle. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
The borrower, Matabishi, is the leader of the "Riziki" business group.  Aged 35, she is a young, yet experienced entrepreneur.  She is also divorced and the mother of two children who both go to school.  

Matabishi sells used shoes.  She displays her merchandise at the public market and sometimes at home.  She started in this business about 11 years ago, using her own money, received from her ex-husband.

This new loan will be used to buy three bales of shoes.  Her goals are to expand her business, feed and educate her children and buy a plot of land.

In the end, she would like to thank Hekima for the support it provides to small-scale entrepreneurs, through microcredit.

loans.use: to buy three bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 49 años , esta casada con Wenceslao y tiene 6 hijos que viven junto a ella en su casa construida con bloques de adobe. Victoria se dedica a la agricultura por está razón cultiva cacao orgánico y barbasco ya que considera que son los productos más rentables de su zona. Cuenta constantemente con el apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos en tareas menores y de ser necesario contrata a trabajadores del lugar para culminar sus tareas pendientes en menos tiempo. Para obtener una buena calidad de cacao utiliza abono orgánico.
Luego de cosechar sus productos los transporta a la ciudad en donde le pagan buenos precios permitiéndole recuperar el dinero que invirtió con ganancias adicionales. Con el tiempo desea reemplazar los bloques de adobe por material noble. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Desea en esta ocasión contar con 2,000 nuevo soles para la compra de herramientas como machetes, tijeras de podar y otros instrumentos para poder cultivas sin problemas.
texts.en:
Victoria is 49 years old. She is married to Wenceslao and has 6 children. They live together in an adobe house. 

Victoria works in agriculture, cultivating organic cocoa and barbasco plants because she considers them to be the most profitable products in her region. She always has the support of her husband and children for minor tasks and when it is necessary she contracts local workers to complete their pending tasks faster. To obtain quality cocoa she uses organic manure. After harvesting, she transports the products to the city where they are bought for a good price, allowing her to earn back the money invested with additional gains. 

Over time, she wants to replace the adobe blocks with a better material. 

This it is her first loan with Kiva. She is very thankful for the financial support that she is receiving, which will allow her to move forward. In addition, she promises to make her payments on time. At this time she requests 2,000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles to purchase tools such as machetes, pruning shears and other instruments to be able to cultivate easily.

loans.use: to purchase tools such as machetes, pruning shears etc.

loans.name: Djalilou

texts.fr: Revendeur de produits d’alimentation générale, Djalilou âgé de 25ans n’as pas encore d’enfant en charge. Il se bat chaque jour pour gagner son pain et espère à l’avenir avec le profit tiré de la vente devenir grossiste et se lancer dans la vie maritale. Il a une ancienneté de 02ans dans l’activité.
texts.en: Djalilou, aged 25, resells general food products.  He does not have any children in his care yet.  He struggles each day to make a living and hopes that the profits from his sales will help him to become a wholesaler one day. He would also like to get married.  He has two years of experience in his field.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Marie Bonie

texts.en:
Marie Bonie is 41-years-old and married with two children, for whom she works very hard to provide.

Marie Bonie runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell.

Marie Bonie has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, canned goods and soft-drinks. 

In the future, Marie Bonie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 35 years old. She sells telephones and has been in the business for the past eight years. With this loan, she would like to buy more phones to sell. She will reinvest her profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy more phones to sell.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is a single man who lives with his mother in Sarnakunq village in the Syunik region. He has been engaged in agriculture and has been running his farm with great love and care for several years. On his farm, Artak currently keeps 12 cows, 22 sheep and 10 chickens. Artak also cultivates barley, potatoes and greens to feed his livestock.

Artak works hard to sustain his mother's life, and agriculture is very important for him.

Now, with a good credit history, Artak has applied for this loan to purchase fuel and renovate his agricultural machinery. This loan is very important for Artak to enlarge his agricultural business and gather more income. He is sure that this loan will increase the profit's of his family, and Artak will be able to ensure a better life for his mother.

loans.use: to pay for fuel and the renovation of his agricultural machinery.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Fatmata from Rokupr Northern area. She is single with 2 children between the ages of 3 and 11. One of her children is attending school. 

Fatmata runs a clothing business; she sells men's and women's outfits She has been running this business for 13 years. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Fatmata says that the main challenge to her business is transportation.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more clothing for men and women. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her clothing inventory. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est coiffeuse et revendeuse de produits de beauté/mèches de cheveux. Avec son mari travaillant au port, elle peine à garantir une nourriture suffisante pour son enfant de trois ans. Pour  renforcer son activité et ses revenus, elle a pour projet d’ouvrir son propre magasin de coiffure et acheter des marchandises. Si un prêt lui permet de faire cela, elle pourrait disposer d’un niveau de vie plus adapté à l’éducation de son enfant.
texts.en: Akouvi is a hairdresser.  She also resells beauty products such as hair extensions.  Her husband works at the harbor and she struggles to provide enough food to her 3-year-old child.  Her goal is to open her own hairdressing shop and to buy some beauty products, in order to boost her business and increase her revenues.  She hopes that a loan will help her to reach her goal, so that she will enjoy a standard of living better suited to her child's educational needs.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, weaves and other products.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is 60-years-old and married with eight children. Rosela works very hard to provide for them.

Rosela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 19,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy groceries to sell at her store.

Rosela has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as soap, detergent, sardines and snack foods. 

In the future, Rosela would like to build and expand her business in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Ellyen

texts.en:
Ellyen is 39-years-old, married and has two children, who are both in school.

Ellyen is in the agricultural industry, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ellyen requested a loan of 19,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ellyen has been raising pigs for five years and has borrowed 14 times from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ellyen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica tiene 29 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y su hija. Jessica se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas de diversos sabores y marcas, para eso cuenta con una refrigeradora donde guarda sus productos. Se inició hace 3 años comprando en pocas cantidades con su propio capital, siempre ha trabajado sola y viendo la buena acogida que tuvo decidió seguir hacia adelante. Tiene planes de aumentar el stock de sus mercaderías y así ver crecer su negocio y con las ganancias económicas desea incursionar en actividades de carpintería con su esposo. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir desarrollando su negocio, está convencida que seguirá siendo una cliente muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosas de diversas marcas y sabores.
texts.en: Jessica is 29 years old. She is married and lives in her own home with her husband and their daughter. Jessica sells all sorts of soft drinks and has a refrigerator where she stores her products. She started her business three years ago, buying small quantities with her own money. She has always worked on her own and, seeing how well the business was going, she decided to continue. She plans to increase the stock she carries and expand her business. She will use her profits to start a carpentry business with her husband. She is requesting 1000 soles and is very grateful to those who will contribute to the loan she needs to keep developing her business. She is positive that she will continue to be a reliable client and make her payments on time. She will use the amount requested to purchase a variety of brands and flavors of soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy a variety of soft drinks to sell in her business.

loans.name: Belkis Jakeline

texts.es:
La Joven Belkis, de 22  años vive en su casa de habitación ubicada en una colonia de  Nacaome Valle en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de ropa como ser pantalones, camisas, shores, vestidos, faldas de telas y ropa interior,  entre otros.
Belkis sus ventas son de lunes a domingo, sale a vender a diferentes comunidades cercanas de donde ella vive, es una señora muy emprendedora y trabajadora.
Belkis está solicitando  el préstamo para la compra de fardos de ropa como ser faldas, vestidos, blusas, camisetas, pantalones, etc. tiene su clientela establecida y espera que el préstamo le genere buenos ingresos para que su estilo de vida y el de su familia mejore un poco. 
Belkis su sueño es ampliar mas su negocio 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2013
texts.en:
Young Belkis is 22 years old. She lives in a one-room house in village in Nacaome Valley in southern Honduras. She has been selling clothing for several years, including pants, shirts, shorts, dresses, skirts, and lingerie. Belkis works from Monday to Sunday; she travels to nearby communities to sell her goods. She is a very enterprising and hardworking woman. Belkis is requesting a loan to buy bales of clothing such as skirts, dresses, blouses, t-shirts, and pants. She has an established customer base and hopes that the loan will afford her good income so that she can improve her family's living situation a little. Belkis's dream is to expand her business further.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2013

loans.use: to buy skirts, dresses, blouses, t-shirts, pants, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Flor Del Durazno Group

texts.es:
El señor Mario de estado civil casado, tiene 40 años de edad, de escolaridad 6to. primaria, tiene 5 hijos y 3 de ellos estan estudiando, él se dedic a la agricultura, siembra café y maíz, inició este negocio con las ganancias de un negocio que realizó, compro unas plantitas de café y hasta la fecha lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien es ama de casa y lo ayuda en la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de fertilizante para abonar y para que sus cosechas sean más abundantes,en el futuro prómimo desea tener más terreno para poder cultivar mas cosechas y obtenes mejores ganancias; los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a sembrar maíz, café y frutas.
texts.en:
Mario is 40 years old and married. He attended school through the sixth grade. He has five children, three of whom are in school. He is a farmer, growing coffee and corn. He started the business with the money he made from another business. He bought some coffee bushes and has been farming for five years. His wife, who stays at home, helps him with the farming.
He leads a group and is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to increase his crop yields. In the near future he hopes to acquire more land so he can plant more crops and earn more income. The other members of the group grow corn, coffee, and fruits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for coffee and corn.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  Benkadi 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 7 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à NAGOUSSO commune de moribila  cercle  de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 4eme prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  HAWA, 1 ere  femme debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Kimparana, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 30.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women who are, on average, 41 years old with seven children each. They all live in traditional families in Nagousso, in the Moribila commune, Cercle of San (fourth administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Hawa, a member of the group, grows groundnut. In the photo, she is in the standing row, first from the left.

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds, small tools and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate 0.5 hectare (1.23 acre) of land.

After the harvest, she will sell her production to both men and women in her own village and in Kimparana. She is expecting to make a profit of 30,000 CFA francs at the end of the season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and buy agricultural inputs, small tools and seeds.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
La Señora Olga de 44  años, vive con sus dos hijos en su casa de habitación ubicada en una colonia de San Lorenzo,  Valle en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica a la venta de tortillas.
Doña Olga vende su producto por encargo y solo los entrega a diferentes vecinos que viven cerca de ella, esto le ayuda para fortalecer más sus ingresos, es muy trabajadora y tiene muchos deseos de  salir adelante.
Doña Olga está solicitando  el préstamo para compra de cargas de maíz y de leña y también quiere comprar material para cemento y arena para construir como una pila,  ya que se las están dando a buen precio y por la demanda que tiene de clientes requiere comprarlo para así tenerlo almacenado y no está comprando por partes.
Doña Olga su sueño es poder ampliar mas su negocio.
  
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2013
texts.en:
Olga is 44 years old and lives with her two children in their home in a neighborhood of San Lorenzo, Valle, in the southern part of Honduras. She works selling tortillas, which she sells by order to various neighbors who live nearby. She says that her business helps a lot with her income. Olga is very hardworking and has a strong desire to get ahead.

Olga is requesting a loan to buy loads of corn and firewood. She would also like to buy cement and sand and other materials to build a sink. She says that these materials are currently available at a good price, and that she will need to buy them because of the demand of her customers. This way she will be able to store them and will not have to buy them a little bit at a time. Olga’s dream is grow her business.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en: Seraphine is 25 years old. She sells clothes and has been in this business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to add to her savings.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Kadiatu from Kambia in the northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with four children between the ages of 3 and 12, and has four additional dependents at home. 

In 2003, Kadiatu established her cookery business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business every day starting at 4:30 am; she will not rest until the food is finished. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of financing to expand her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan to buy food items like rice, fish and palm oil to expand her cookery business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to expand her business to restaurant levels. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy food items like rice, fish and palm oil to expand her cookery business.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Abiatu from Kambia. She is married, with a two-year-old child.  She began her business to have a permanent source of income alongside operating a farming as another source of income. 

Abiatu runs a home product business. She sells rubber bowls, buckets and food containers. She has been running this business since 2002. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night.   Abiatu says that her business is going well because she started with a small amount through BRAC.

Abiatu has requested a loan to buy rubber bowls, buckets and food containers.  The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her status of living. 

In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy rubber bowls, buckets and food containers.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su familia, su esposa y sus hijo, el cual tiene 10 años de edad. El, se dedica a l cultivo de maíz y pipián; el oficio lo aprendió con su familia y lo desempeña desde hace 6 años, la dificultad a la que se puede enfrentar son los cambios climáticos que se están  presentando.
El préstamo que requiere lo utilizara para comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a tener todo lo necesario para aplicarle al cultivo y así obtener una buena cosecha.
Su sueño es lograr sacar una excelente producción para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his family, which includes his wife and 10-year-old child. He grows corn and pumpkins. Manuel learned this trade from his family and has been working for six years. The difficulty he faces includes dealing with weather changes.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy farming supplies such as compost, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, fungicides, and other items. This investment will help to provide everything he needs for his crops so that he can obtain a good harvest. His dream is to achieve excellent production so that he can have a better income.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, fungicides, and other items.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Emma from Kambia . She is married, with four children between the ages of 3 and 17. Two of the children are currently going to school.  

Emma runs a general items store at her house; she sells soap, milk, pure water, sodas and biscuits. She has been running this business since 2004. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night.   Emma says that her business is going well because she started with a small amount through BRAC.

Emma has requested a loan to buy more soap, milk, pure water, and drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and buy a freezer and a television to improve her status of living. 

In the future, Emma plans to buy land and build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more soap, milk, pure water and drinks.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es: Jacqueline tiene 29 años, es soltera, y vive en casa de su madre. Jacqueline se dedica a la venta de calzados usados como zapatos, zapatillas, sandalias y otros. Ofrece sus productos en su local alquilado,  siempre atiende con una sonrisa amable. Se inició vendiendo productos usados, pero con el tiempo fue incrementando su capital y ahora también vende calzados nuevos. Lleva en este negocio 4 años y desea continuar haciéndolo por mucho más tiempo. Considera su negocio rentable por las buenas ganancias económicas que recibe y porque tiene clientes frecuentes. Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico fijo que le sirve para solventar sus gastos, además se siente una persona productiva y desea convertirse en una prospera empresaria. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará calzados usados para damas y caballeros, como zapatillas, zapatos y sandalias para aumentar la variedad que ofrece.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 29 years old, single, and lives in her mother’s home. She works selling secondhand footwear such as shoes, sports shoes, sandals and others. She sells her products from a location she rents, and she always waits on her customers with a kind smile. She started selling only secondhand items, but with time she increased her working capital and now she also sells new footwear. She has been working at this business for four years now, and she would like to continue working at it for many more. She considers her business a success because of the profits she receives from it and because she has many repeat customers. She likes her business very much because it provides her with a fixed income stream that she uses to pay her expenses. Moreover, she feels productive and would like to become a prosperous businessperson.

Jacqueline is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN to buy secondhand footwear for women and men, such as shoes, sports shoes and sandals. With this additional stock she will increase the variety of items she offers. Jacqueline is very happy to know that she has financial support, and to feel secure of being able to move ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy secondhand footwear such as shoes, sports shoes and sandals for her business.

loans.name: Karla

texts.es:
La Joven Karla  de 24  años, vive en su casa de habitación ubicada en una colonia de  Nacaome, Valle en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 05  años a la venta de productos alimenticios como ser arroz, frijoles, manteca, huevos, pollo, espaguetis, salsas, granos básicos entre otros.
Karla su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación en donde es visitada por toda su clientela, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo, es una señora muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando.
Karla solicitando  el préstamo  para comprar más productos para su pulpería como manteca, frijoles, azúcar, arroz, café, pan, papel higiénico, leche, mantequilla, etc. ya que su cliente a aumentado y necesita tener variedad de mercadería para así poder vender más y tener mejores ganancias 
Karla su sueño ampliar su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2013.
texts.en:
Young Karla is 24 years old and lives in her house which is located in a colony in Nacaome, Valle, in the south region of Honduras.

For the past five years Karla has been making a living in the sale of food products such as rice, beans, butter, eggs, chicken, spaghetti, sauces, basic grains and others. Her business is located in her house, where all her clients visit her. She sells from Monday to Sunday and is a very enterprising woman who is eager to work.

Karla is requesting a loan to buy more products for her store, such as butter, beans, sugar, rice, coffee, bread, toilet paper, milk and others, since her clientele has increased and she needs to have a wider variety of products to sell and make a higher profit. 

Karla's dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy butter, beans, sugar, rice, coffee, bread, toilet paper, milk and other products for her store

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: Maura, es una madre que se preocupa por la educación de sus hijos, en la actualidad tiene a uno a su cargo, quien está cursando su último año de universidad, ella tiene su pareja quien la apoya, maura continua con su pequeño negocio de pulpería con lo que intenta salir adelante junto a su familia. Solicita el crédito para invertirle a su negocio con productos de granos básicos, verduras, frutas entre otros de mayor demanda por los vecinos del barrio donde habita, esto le permitirá mantener las ventas y se apoyara a pagar los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Maura is a mother who is concerned about the education of her children. She currently has one child under her care who is finishing the last year of university. Even though Maura has a partner who supports her, she continues to manage her small grocery business with the intention of helping her family get ahead.

She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in products for her business such as basic grains, vegetables, fruits, and other items that are in great demand among the neighbors in the neighborhood where she lives. This will allow her to maintain her sales and to help pay for the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, vegetables, fruits, and other items.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana tiene 22 años, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en su casa propia. Diana se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas y cervezas. Tiene una refrigeradora que ha logrado conseguir con ayuda de sus padres y en ella coloca a diario todos los productos. Lleva ejerciendo esta función desde hace 2 años y los ingresos económicos que percibe le han servido para mejorar su vivienda y cubrir algunas necesidades básicas. Diana desea establecer otro tipo de negocio que le de mayores ingresos como una tienda de ropas. Espera lograrlo con el transcurrir del tiempo, mientras tanto no descansa en su lucha diaria en su principal actividad. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1300, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable. Con el monto solicitado comprará bebidas de diversas marcas y sabores para aumentar la variedad y calidad de los productos que ofrece.
texts.en:
Diana is 22 years old and single, and lives with her parents in their home. Diana works selling soft drinks and beer. She has a refrigerator that she managed to buy with the help of her parents, and she stocks it daily with all of her products. She has been doing this work for two years, and the income she has earned has helped her to improve her home and to cover some basic necessities.

Diana wants to start a different type of business which would generate better earnings, such as a clothing store. She hopes to do this eventually, but in the meantime she doesn't rest in her daily struggle at her main business. 

For this loan she is asking for 1,300 soles [PEN]. She is very moved to know that there are people who would offer her a hand economically to continue to work at her job, and so she is committed to being punctual and responsible. With the amount she is asking for she will buy drinks of different brands and flavours to increase the variety and quality of the products she offers.

loans.use: to buy different soft drinks to sell at her store.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Emma from the northern part of Kambia area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 5 children; she also has three relatives at home. In 2008, Haja established her general stock business. She began her business because she needed to create income to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 7 days per week and 15 hours per day. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation.

Emma requires a loan in order to buy more bags of rice for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take good care of her family. In the future, Emma plans to be an agent to supply rice. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice to resell.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio tiene 66 años, está casado y vive en su casa propia junta su esposa. Julio se dedica a la venta de golosinas y postres elaborado por sus propias manos. Vende todo tipo de galletas, caramelos, dulces, entre otras cosas. Julio prepara sus postres y refrescos usando los mejores ingredientes y las mejores frutas tropicales de la ciudad. Tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado de la ciudad, gracias a los 11 años que lleva en esta actividad ha podido acentuar el gusto y sabor perfecto que caracterizan a sus postres. Trabaja siempre solo, lo que más le pone feliz es observar a sus clientes degustar con mucho placer los postres que el vende. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, agradece a todas las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de acceder al financiamiento que requiere para que continúe trabajando. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará galletas, caramelos, cereales, frutas, y todo lo necesario para continuar preparando los postres que pone a la venta en su negocio.
texts.en:
Julio is 66 years old and married, and lives in his own home with his wife. Julio works selling treats and desserts that he makes himself. He sells all different types of cookies, candies and sweets, among other things. Julio makes his desserts and soft drinks using the best ingredients and the best tropical fruits in the city. 

He has a small stand at the market in the city, and thanks to the eleven years he has spent doing this work he has been able to perfect the taste and flavour that characterize his desserts. He always works alone. What makes him the happiest is seeing his customers eating and enjoying the desserts he sells. 

On this occasion, he is asking for 2000 soles [PEN]. He is grateful to all the people who are providing him with the opportunity to access the financing he needs to continue working. Furthermore, he is committed to complying with the payments on his loan. With the amount he is asking for, he will buy biscuits, candies, cereals, and all the necessary items to continue preparing the desserts that he sells at his business

loans.use: to buy biscuits, candies, cereals and other products to prepare desserts.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Fatmata from the Kambia Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children ages five and eight and has four additional dependents who live with her because they are relatives. Fatmata established a general store business in 2003. She started her business because she needed to create an income to support her home. Fatmata works every day, 12 hours a day. Her main business challenge is inflation.

Fatmata is requesting a loan to buy more mayonnaise, ketchup, and a variety of cooking seasonings. She will use the extra income from her loan to increase her business and improve her family’s standard of living. In the future, Fatmata plans to become a wholesaler. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy mayonnaise, ketchup, and a variety of cooking seasonings

loans.name: Martha Margarita

texts.es:
La Sra. Martha Margarita tiene viviendo en Piedras Negras desde hace  26 años, es una persona muy trabajadora, ella es una mujer casada y madre de un niño pequeño, junto a su marido acaban de obtener una casa. La Sra. Martha Margarita trabaja como radio operadora en una base de taxis de la cd. de Piedras Negras, son personas muy luchistas, para darle lo mejor a su hijo y en ningun momento le haga falta nada, se encuentran construyendo su casa,pues quisieran en un futuro tener un patrimonio muy lindo y agradable para que así a su hijo no se le dificulte al momento de hacer su vida junto a su propia familia.
Pide apoyo através de KIVA para instalar techo en su hogar y vivir comodamente, quisiera en un futuro al terminar su casa, empezar a pagar un automóvil para utilizarlo como taxi y darle servicio a la comunidad.
texts.en:
Martha Margarita has lived in Piedras Negras for 26 years.  She is a very hardworking person who is married and has a small child.  Together with her husband, they just bought a house.  Martha Margarita works as a radio operator for a taxi company in the city of Piedras Negras.  She and her husband are people who work very hard to give the best to their son so that he never lacks anything.  They are building their house because they want to have a very beautiful and pleasant property, one that they can leave to their son so that he faces no difficulties in life when he forms his own family.

Martha Margarita is requesting support through Kiva to build a roof on her home so that she can live comfortably.  In the future, she would like to finish building her home so that she can start to pay for an automobile which she could use as a taxi, providing services to the community.

loans.use: to put a roof on her house

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta lives in Lejan village of the Lori region with her son and husband. Her husband is currently out of the country and working abroad to sustain his family. Marieta works in agriculture and she has to run her farm alone. She keeps four cows and two pigs and cultivates wheat and potato. Marieta is very hardworking, and due to her work over the years, she now owns a beautiful and profitable farm. She would like to increase her family’s income.

Marieta is requesting a loan to buy three oxen, fertilizer, and cover fuel costs. Her loan will help her have everything available that she needs to expand her business. Marieta hopes that Kiva lenders will give her an opportunity to enrich her farm and provide her son with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy three oxen, fertilizer, and cover fuel costs

loans.name: Flor De La Tierra Group

texts.es:
El señor Francisco, su estado civil es casado, de edad 40 años, no le dieron la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 7 hijos y 4 de ellos estan estudiando, él se dedica a la agricultura cultiva maíz y frijol, inició este negocio comprando solamente una plantitas y hasta la fecha lleva 15 dichosos años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de fertilizante para sus cultivos de café y maíz, para tener mejores cosechas, en el futuro desea tener mas terreno para poder sembrarlo de café y obtener mejores ganancias; los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a actividades agrícolas. Cabe mencionar que en la fotografía aparecen 10 personas, pero, solamente a 8 de ellos se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco is 40 years old, married, and did not have the opportunity to study. He has seven children, four of whom are studying. Francisco is a farmer who grows corn and beans. He started his business by purchasing only a few seedlings and now he has 15 years of experience in this line of work.

Francisco organized a group so that he could request a loan. He will use the money to buy fertilizers for his coffee and corn crops so that he will have a better harvest. In the future, he would like to have more land for planting coffee so that he can generate more income.

The other members of the group are also farmers. It should be mentioned that there are 10 people in the photograph, but only 8 of them are participating in this loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his coffee and corn crops.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es:
La señora Artemio tiene 48 años de edad es originario del estado de Veracruz tiene ya mas de 25 años radicando en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, esta casado con la señora Ernestina con quien tiene tres hijos que están estudiando, dos en la primaria y el mayor en la secundaria. El señor Artemio es trabaja para la ciudad en el aria de mantenimiento y en horario adicional a su trabajo es ayudante de un taller de enderezado y pintura, su esposa la señora Ernestina de dedica a la limpieza de una casa particular. 
Están solicitando un crédito KIVA para realizar una mejora a su vivienda ya que le esta haciendo falta un techo de madera al frente de su casa pero no cuenta con el dinero necesaria para comprar el material y que el Señor Artemio se encargara de realizar la mejora. Desean mejorar el patrimonio de sus hijos y que tengan un lugar mas seguro donde vivir y cuando ellos se encuentren en sus trabajos sus hijos estén bien en su casa.
Con el sueldo que recibe el Sr Artemio es para pagar el crédito y que los gastos familiares y escolares se encargara la señora Ernestina con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sr. Artemio is 48 years old and originally from the state of Veracruz. He moved to the city of Nuevo Laredo more than 25 years ago. Artemio is married to Sra. Ernestina and they have three children who are studying. Two of them are in elementary school and the oldest one is in high school.

Sr. Artemio works for the city in the maintenance department and also has a second job as an assistant at a paint and body shop. His wife, Sra. Ernestina, works as a housekeeper at a private residence. He is requesting a Kiva loan so that he can make an improvement to his home. The front part of his house lacks a wooden roof, but he does not have the necessary funds to buy materials. Sr. Artemio will be responsible for making this improvement. He wants to improve his home for his children so that they will have a more secure place to live. While he and his wife are at work, his children will be safe at home.

With the salary he earns, Sr. Artemio will be able to repay the loan. The family and school expenses will be paid with the income Sra. Ernestina earns from her work.

loans.use: to build a wooden roof over the front part of his house.

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Memuna from the Kambia Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children, all of whom are currently attending school.  Since 1999, Memuna has been running a grocery stand in her community where she sells rice, mayonnaise, and a variety of cooking seasonings. She works 11 hours every day and her main business challenges are the poor road network within her operation area and insufficient capital. 

Memuna is requesting a loan to buy rice, mayonnaise, and cooking seasonings. The extra income from her loan will allow her to educate her children and take good care of her family. In the future, Memuna plans to expand her business and have a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, mayonnaise, and cooking seasonings

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Adama from the Kambia Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children who are currently attending school.  Since 2001, Adama has been running a grocery stand within her community where she she sells rice, cooking oil, and cooking seasonings. She works 12 hours a day and her main business challenges are the high cost of transportation and insufficient capital. 

Adama is requesting a loan to buy rice, cooking oil, and cooking seasonings. The extra income from her loan will allow her to educate her children and take good care of her family. In the future, Adama plans to build a house. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, and cooking seasonings

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa has a nice family who help each other out with their farming business. She has been involved in agriculture for several years and breeds cattle (cows and bulls) and sheep as well as cultivates different type of greens for feeding them. Larisa's husband is 70 years old and is retired with a pension, but he supports Larisa on their farm and is sure that working together ensures that their family will earn a decent income.

Larisa is requesting a loan to expand her farm and increase her income. She will purchase two oxen and forage for her livestock. Her farm isn’t very big and also needs some improvements and she wants to expand her agricultural production to earn more income and improve her farm as well as her family's life. Larisa waits for your support.

loans.use: to purchase two oxen and forage for her livestock

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 31 años, está casada con Efraín y tiene 3 hijos con quienes viven en su casa construida a base de adobe. Cuando tenía 19 años y con la llegada de su primer hijo decidió trabajar junto a su esposo en la agricultura. Es así como su padre le cedió un terreno agrícola de media hectárea en donde empezó a cultivar cacao y árboles frutales. Al inicio no contaba con dinero suficiente para contratar trabajadores y realizar el reemplazo de varios árboles desfasados que existían en sus terrenos, fue así que un familiar suyo le proporcionaba pequeños préstamos para solucionar los inconvenientes que tenía. Con el paso de los años logró a traves de sus ganancias comprar otra parcela en donde amplió sus plantaciones de cacao y logró mejorar progresivamente sus ingresos. Suele contratar trabajadores del lugar quienes le apoyan en el retiro de maleza y cosecha de sus granos cacaoteros. Desea con el tiempo a través de sus ganancias mejorar su vivienda y construirlo con ladrillos y cemento para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.  Desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico para fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 31 years old.  She is married to Efrain, and has 3 children who she lives with in her own house, made of adobe.  With the arrival of her first child when she was 19 years old, she decided to start working with her husband in agriculture.  Her father gave her a half-hectare of land where she starting to cultivate cocoa and fruit trees.  At first, she didn't have enough money to hire workers or to replace the various trees on their land that were not producing.  A relative provided her with small loans to solve the problems that she had.  Over the years, she managed through her earnings to buy another parcel of land where she expanded her cocoa plantings and thereby progressively increased her income.  She frequently hires workers from the area who assist her with the weeding and the harvest of her cocoa beans.  

Over time, with her earnings, she wants to improve her house and rebuild it with bricks and cement so that she can improve her family's quality of life.  This is her first loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support that she is receiving that will help her to continue to make progress.  In addition, she promises to make her payments on time.  She wants to borrow 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy organic fertilizer to fertilize her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Matilda's Group

texts.en:
Matilda is married and 43. She finished six years of elementary school and has a daughter, who is thirteen years old and in schooling. Her husband is 50 years old, called Emmanuel, and he is a trader. Matilda operates drinking bar, which she has been doing for fifteen years.  She operates it to help her family survive and improve.  Her fifteen years work experience has contributed massively toward her family life and she also works together with her husband. 

Matilda is the leader of this group and this is her second loan cycle with kiva and her forth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. She is applying for a loan amount of GH 1,500 to buy six boxes of coca-cola and six boxes of malta guinness to sell to customers. She hopes to grow her capital, ensure her daughter reaches the highest level of education and support her husband to complete their building project. Janet, the other group member is also a drinking spot operator. Together they will need a total amount of GH 2,900 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy six boxes of coca-cola and six boxes of malta guinness to sell to customers.

loans.name: Isata       S

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 20-year-old Isata from Port Loko. She is married with one child. She got married at an early age so she could earn income to support her home. 

Isata runs a general store in her house. She sells bags of rice to the community. She has been running this business since 2010. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Isata says that, at present, her hardship is insufficient capital to run her business.

Isata has requested a loan in order to buy more bags of rice and gallons of oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to expand her business. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice and gallons of oil to sell

loans.name: Adama    S

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Adama from Port Loko. She is married with two children, ages 11 and 18 years. Her children are currently going to school. Her husband is a policeman, but his income is not enough to support the home.

Adama runs general stock items at her house; she sells cigarettes, milk, pure water, soda and biscuits. She has been running this business since 1996. She works at the business throughout the week from morning to night. Adama says that she is facing challenges with transportation.

Adama has requested a loan in order to buy more cigarettes, milk, pure water, and drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. 

In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cigarettes, milk, pure water, and drinks.

loans.name: Nadyr

texts.es:
Nadyr trabaja como auxiliar de emfermeria, tambien hace labores de secretariado,vive con sus padrinos en la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja  ocho horas al día ya que es el único sustento que tiene.
Nadyr requiere el credito para el tramite de su titulo en provision nacional.
El sueño de Nadyr es terminar sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Nadyr works as a nursing assistant, but she also provides secretarial services. She lives with her godparents in the District of Achachicala in the city of La Paz. Nadyr works eight hours a day and these jobs are her only source of income.

She is requesting a loan so that she can pay the filing fees for her national certification. Her dream is to finish her higher education.

loans.use: to pay the filing fees for her national certification.

loans.name: Vilma Doris

texts.es:
La Señora Vilma  de 34  años, de edad es madre soltera, vive con su mama en su casa de habitación, tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella y vive en una comunidad Nacaome, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Vilma se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 12 años, al negocio de la venta de tamales, pan, queso, mantequilla, golosinas, etc. es una mujer sola que está luchando por sacar adelante a sus hijos es por tal razón que se dedica desde muy temprano a preparar sus ventas para salir a venderlas a los diferentes lugares que visita.
Doña Vilma es una mujer muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante con el apoyo del préstamo pretende comprar más productos como carnes, hojas, harina, huevos, leche, azúcar, pan, etc.  Para elaborar lo que son sus quesos, tamales, verduras, pan, etc. con las ganancias pretende seguir apoyando a sus hijos en los estudios.
Doña Vilma está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma, su sueño es mejorar su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Junio 2013
texts.en:
Señora Vilma is a 34-year-old old single mother. She lives with her mother in her home. She has three children who depend on her. She lives in the Nacaome community in southern Honduras.
For the past 12 years, Vilma has made her living with her business of selling tamales, bread, cheese, butter, candy, etc. She is a single woman who is struggling to help her children get ahead. It is for this reason that she gets up very early to prepare her goods to sell in the different places she visits.
Vilma is a very hardworking woman who wants to get ahead with the support of this loan which will be used to buy more products like meat, leaves, flour, eggs, milk, sugar, bread, etc. to increase her supply of her cheeses, tamales, vegetables, bread, etc. With the profits, she plans to continue supporting her children in school.
Vilma is very happy to continue working with Prisma, her dream is to improve her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – June 2013

loans.use: to purchase meat, leaves, flour, eggs, milk, sugar and bread, etc. for her business

loans.name: Linda

texts.es: Linda tiene 42 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Linda hace servicio dental a las personas, su principal función es colaborar como asistente en el consultorio que ha constituido junto su esposo hace 9 años, alguna incomodidad dental o simplemente ayuda a mejorar la apariencia de una persona otorgándole una linda sonrisa. Le gusta mucho su actividad pues le permite llevar una adecuada organización y porque además le genera buena ganancias económicas gracias a la gran cantidad de personas que atiende en su consultorio, espera seguir trabajando para seguir creciendo y así progresar en todas la áreas de su vida. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segunda de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará amalgamas y porcelana para contribuir a la implantación del laboratorio dental.
texts.en:
Linda is 42 years old, she is married and lives with her husband and four children in a house she owns. Linda works as a dental assistant in an office she and her husband started nine years ago. They treat dental problems as well as cosmetic dental issues in order to provide patients with beautiful smiles. Linda enjoys her job because it allows her to stay organized and also provides a good source of income because of the number of people her office attends. Linda hopes to keep working and growing in order to progress in all aspects of her life. 

Linda is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support. She feels like this is the proper moment to advance her business. She also pledges to make her repayments on time. With the loan amount, Linda will buy amalgamate and porcelain to add to her dental laboratory equipment.

loans.use: to buy equipment to improve her dental consultant business.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La Señora Aurora de 44  años, vive con su esposo  y dos hijos en su casa de habitación ubicada en una colonia de Nacaome, Valle en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica a la venta de tortillas en donde las va entregar por encargo a sus diferentes vecinos y personas de su comunidad.
Doña Aurora también vende ropa americana que esto le ayuda para fortalecer mas sus ingresos, es muy trabajadora y le gusta salir adelante con esta inversión.
Doña Aurora está solicitando  el préstamo para la compra de cargas de maíz y leña ya que se las están dando a buen precio y por la demanda que tiene de clientes requiere comprarlo para así tenerlo almacenado y no está comprando por partes y también comprar faldas, vestidos, blusas, camisas, pantalones, calzonetas, etc. para su segundo negocio.   
Doña Aurora su sueño es que sus negocios sean más grandes y poder asi ayudar a sus hijos a salir adelante en sus estudios.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Junio del 2013.
texts.en:
Aurora is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their home, located in a Nacaome neighborhood, in a southern Honduras valley zone.  She sells tortillas and delivers them on order to her various neighbors and people in her community.

Aurora also sells American clothing and this helps her fortify her income.  She is a very hard worker and wants to get ahead with this investment.
 
Aurora is asking for this loan in order to buy corn and firewood, now that she is getting good prices and high customer demand.  In this way she can store it and not have to buy it a little at a time.  She also wants to buy skirts, dresses, blouses, shirts, pants, undergarments, etc. for her second business.

Aurora’s dream is for her businesses to grow and in this way be able to help her children get ahead with their studies.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2013.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a teacher with 10 years of experience teaching at a local school. She lives with her husband, parents-in-law (in the photo), and two kids (in the photo). Anna's husband is now working abroad and trying to financially support his family. Together with her parents-in-law, Anna is involved in agriculture. They keep 21 cows, a pig, and also grow different types of vegetables. 

The whole family works hard to gather a good harvest and sell it locally. Now, they have some financial difficulties and are not able to cover the farming costs. Anna needs financial support to purchase seeds and fertilizer for successful cultivation of the land. As her parents-in-law are retired and aren't able to gather the harvest, Anna needs to hire workers and arrange the transportation of that harvest to the market.

Now this hardworking woman with perfect credit history has applied to SEF for a loan. The loan is very important for her to cover all the mentioned costs and to be able to earn more agricultural income.

She dreams of having a big and profitable farm, so her husband won't have to go abroad and live far from his farm.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds, and cultivation costs

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: Daniela es una joven de 22 años de edad, es soltera y aún no tiene hijos. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de sombreros en el área metropolitana y en los pueblos de Antioquia, donde ya es reconocida por los clientes. Esta actividad la conoció porque es una herencia familiar. La prestataria es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, le gusta estar activa y viajando para vender sus productos y así conseguir los ingresos para apoyar el sostenimiento de su hogar. El crédito que solicita dese invertirlo en dos conceptos, primero en la compra de más mercancía (sombreros) por un valor de $503.000 y pagar el crédito que tiene vigente por valor de $497.000 ya que es el tercer crédito que adquiere con la Corporación. Su mayor sueño es tener un local propio, que sea reconocido y comercializar sus productos para generar mejores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Daniela is a young woman who is 22 years of age. She is single and has no children. Daniela currently sells hats in the metropolitan area and in the small towns of Antioquia region, where she is well-known among her customers. She is familiar with this business because she learned the trade from her family.

Daniela is an enterprising and hardworking woman who enjoys being active and traveling in order to sell her products. As a result, the income she earns helps to sustain her household. The loan she is requesting will be invested two ways. First of all, she will buy more merchandise (hats) valued at 503,000 COP. She will also pay off an outstanding debt currently valued at 497,000 COP.

This is the third time she has requested a loan from Interactuar. Her greatest wish is to have her own shop where she can sell her products and become well-known. This would enable her to generate more income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more hats to sell and to pay off an outstanding debt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing for women and kids, as well as footwear to sell.

loans.name: Warantu

texts.en:
This is Warantu, she is in her late thirties, and is from Port Loko in the northern area of Sierra Leone. She is married, and has four children. Three of her children are currently attending school.  

Warantu runs a food stand within her community where she sells onions, peppers, rice, and palm oil. She has been running this business since 2010. She works at the business for eleven hours every day. She says that the main challenges to her business are the poor road network within her operation area, and insufficient capital to operate her business.

Warantu has requested a loan to buy onions, rice, palm oil and soft drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and take good care of her family. 

In the future, she plans to build a house. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy onions, rice, palm oil and soft drinks.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar, originally from El Salvador, has been a certified mechanic for the last 21 years and is the owner-operator of Auto Center Repair and Services LLC, a mechanic shop established in 1998 in Rockville, Maryland.

Auto Center Repair and Services provides general car repair and maintenance, including muffler repair and complete tire services. It is a small and “old style” shop, but with a loyal clientele and very personalized service.

Business has been steady for years, but Edgar is looking to modernize the business in order to maintain the business competitiveness and eventually to start expanding sales.
