Edgar is requesting $10,000 to update the equipment to the latest technology (new engine scanner and a tire balancing machine), to increase the inventory of supplies/parts, and to improve the client waiting room.

loans.use: to update the equipment to the latest technology, to increase the inventory of supplies/parts, and to improve the client waiting room.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Doña Ángela de 57 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños desde hace 10 años vende de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados y colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña Ángela esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar más ropa interior por mayor y seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poder tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Doña Ángela is 57 years old and lives in her own home with her life companion. For the past 10 years, she has been selling undergarments for women, men, and children as a street vendor at different markets and neighborhoods near her home. With the income she generates from her sales, Ángela is able to pay a few household expenses.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more undergarments in bulk and continue her business. This is her only source of income, so the loan will enable her to have better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more undergarments in bulk.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 22-year-old Mariatu from Port Loko in the northern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with two children between the ages of two and four. 

Mariatu runs a food stand within her community where she sells rice, palm oil and sugar. She has been running this business since 2010; she began this business to take care of her family.  She works at the business eleven hours every day. She says the main challenges to her business are the poor road network within her operation area, and insufficient capital to operate her business.

Mariatu has requested a loan to buy rice, palm oil, sugar and soft drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her family status. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business even more. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, sugar and soft drinks.

loans.name: Umu

texts.en:
Meet 34-year-old Umu from Port Loko  in the northern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with one child aged 14 years, and she has two additional dependents who live with her because they are relatives. In 2001, Umu established her grocery store business. She began her business because she needed to contribute in supporting the home. She works at the business every day, 12 hours per day. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Umu requires a loan in order to buy more ketchup, baby food, mayonnaise, and assorted drinks. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business so she can attract customers and improve her family's standard of living. In the future, Umu plans to import her goods from a neighboring country. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more ketchup, baby food, mayonnaise, and assorted drinks

loans.name: Cerro Verde Group

texts.es:
El comité Cerro Verde, se conformó con la iniciativa de una de las miembros, actualmente se encuentran  en el  2do ciclo, con trece integrantes, de la Comunidad de Ybyrarobana a  80 km de  Curuguaty, comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Ellas son de una compañía muy alejada y de difícil acceso.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Alejandrina, quien se dedica a actividades rurales, como ser cría, venta y faena de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, patos, cabras y demás. Cuenta que por medio de este trabajo es que está ayudando a su familia, pese a que es un trabajo muy difícil, lo hace para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos y que no les falte nada. Ella comenta que sueña con poder tener una granja donde pueda tener más animales para criar y vender. Agradece por esta oportunidad que ella y su familia están recibiendo por medio de esto.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, y de esa forma poder seguir con su pequeño emprendimiento como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The committee named “Cerro Verde” (Green Hill) was formed as a result of the initiative of one of its members. The group is currently in its second loan cycle with 13 members. They are from the community of Ybyrarobana, which is 80 km from Curuguaty. All of the members of this Women’s Committee work and help one another get ahead. They live in a very remote neighborhood that is difficult to access.

One of the members is Sra. Alejandrina, who engages in farm activities such as raising and selling animals such as chickens, pigs, ducks, goats, and other creatures. Through her efforts, Alejandrina has been able to help her family even though the work is very difficult. She has been able to help her loved ones because she wants them to lack nothing. Alejandrina says that her dream is to have a farm with more animals that she can raise and sell. She is appreciative of the opportunity she and her family receive from this line of work.

Alejandrina is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of balanced feed for her animals. This will enable her to continue her small enterprise in the same manner as she has done before.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es: Natividad tiene 40 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus hijos. Natividad se dedica a la venta de comida como fideos, frituras, y otros. También vende golosinas y bebidas variadas. Se inició en el negocio hace más de 3 años y hasta el momento lo viene realizando con el apoyo de su esposo y ocasionalmente de su hijo. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la continua clientela que tiene y las buenas ganancias económicas que percibe. Espera seguir trabajando para progresar y salir adelante con su familia, tiene muchos planes para expandir su negocio. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500, agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir desarrollando su negocio, está convencida que seguirá siendo una cliente muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo. Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes y víveres para la preparación de sus comidas  como pollos, carnes, arroz, aceites y otros, además de implementará la variedad de productos que ofrece a la venta.
texts.en:
Natividad is 40 years old and is married. She lives in her own home with her ​​husband and children. Natividad makes her living by selling food like noodles, fried foods, and other foods. She also sells candy, snacks and various beverages. She started the business more than three years ago and since then she has received the assistance of her husband and occasionally her son. She considers her business to be quite profitable because of her return customers and the good financial profits that she receives. 

She hopes to continue working to help her family progress and get ahead. She has many plans to expand her business. On this occasion she is requesting 2500 Peruvian Nuevo Soles. She appreciates those who offer her the loan she needs to keep growing her business. She is convinced that she will remain a very punctual client and pay her fees on time. With the amount requested, she will buy ingredients and supplies to prepare her meals such as chicken, beef, rice, oils and other foods, and introduce a greater variety of products for purchase.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like chicken and oil to cook for her business.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Mabinty from Lunsar's northern area. She is married with 6 children between the ages of 9 years and 24 years. Her children are currently going to school. She also has 10 additional dependents at home.

Mabinty runs a grocery store selling items at her house; she sells milk, pure water, soda, and biscuits. She has been running this business since 2006. She works at the business throughout the week from morning to night. Mabinty says that her business is doing well because she started with a small amount through BRAC.

Mabinty has requested a loan in order to buy more biscuits, milk, pure water, and drinks to sell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to open a permanent business residence. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more biscuits, milk, pure water, and drinks to sell in her grocery store

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Mabinty from the Port Loko Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children and has two relatives at home.  In 2000,  Haja established her home product business. She began her business because she needs to create income to improve her standard of living. She works at the business seven days per week, from morning to night. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation.

Mabinty requires a loan in order to buy radio, cream, spray, and phone accessories for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and also empower herself. In the future, Mabinty plans to grow her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a radio, cream, spray, and phone accessories for resale

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
El señor Carmelo de 44 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 03 hijos en una en su casa de habitación, ubicada en una comunidad de Nacaome  al sur de Honduras.
Don Carmelo se dedica a la venta de  cargas de maíz y sus clientes son los vecinos de la  aldea donde vive y también sale a vender carretadas de leña fuera de la comunidad  se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 25 años. 
Don Carmelo solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas cargas de maíz ya que tiene varios encargos con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende seguir invirtiendo más en su negocio y seguir creciendo. 
Don Carmelo su sueño es poder instalar todo el alambrado eléctrico de su casa ya que hace poco la acaba de construir.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2013
texts.en:
Carmelo is 44 years old. He lives with his wife and their three children in the community of Nacaome in southern Honduras. Carmelo makes a living selling sacks of corn. His customers are principally his neighbors, though he also sells wagon loads of firewood outside of his community. He has been in this business for the last 25 years. 

Carmelo is requesting this loan in order to buy more sacks of corn. He already has many orders to fill and with the support of this loan, he will be able to invest more in his business and continue growing. Carmelo's dream is to be able to install the wires to have electricity in the home he recently built. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2013

loans.use: to buy corn for his business.

loans.name: Tawa

texts.en:
Tawa is 48 years old, and she lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and has seven children aged between 30 and 18. Only one of them is in school, and two of her children live at home. Tawa described herself as a hardworking woman.

For the past three years, she has been running a market table at the local market, where she sells rice, oil, peppers, onions, and similar items.  She sells six days of the week, from 8am to 4pm. She likes her business because of the way customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by husband. She uses a shared taxi every time, to get her goods to her business spot. 

Tawa is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more items to resell at her market table, including rice, oil, peppers, and onions. She plans to build a house for her children.  She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more items to resell at her market table

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel, a Tlaxcalan farmer, is struggling with the increasing costs and diminishing yields resulting from the agrochemical fertilizers he currently uses on his crops. He is investing in a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester because he wants to more effectively use his available cow waste. The digester will convert the manure into renewable, methane-rich biogas and biofertilizer, allowing him to save money, reduce his farm's environmental impact, and increase his crop yields. This loan represents 46% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester for his farm

loans.name: Warah

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 29-year-old Warah from Lunsar's northern area. She is married with 2 children between the ages of 5 years and 10 years. Both of her children attend school. 

Warah runs a clothing business; she sells female and male clothing. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Warah says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation of goods.

Warah has requested a loan to purchase more clothing for men and women. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her clothing materials. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for men and women for selling

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 39-year-old Fatmata from Lunsar. She is widowed with 5 children between the ages of 8 years and 23 years. Three of her children are currently going to school.  

Fatmata runs a general store, selling items at her house; she sells soap, milk, pure water, soda, and biscuits. She has been running this business for 18 years and she works at the business throughout the week from morning to night. Fatmata says that her major problem is the lack of enough capital to run her business. 

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more soap, milk, pure water, and drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her life. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more soap, milk, pure water, and drinks to sell

loans.name: Saffie

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Saffie from Lunsar's northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 3 years and 15 years, and has 2 additional dependents that live with her because they are relatives. 

In 2003, Saffie established her cosmetics business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support her home. She works at the business 7 days per week and 8 hours per day. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and sometimes sales are very slow.

Saffie requires a loan in order to buy more body cream, soap, baby power, and perfume to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business so she can attract customers and improve her family's standard of living. In the future, Saffie plans to import her goods from a neighboring country. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more body cream, soap, baby power, and perfume to sell

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Marie from Lunsar in the Northern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with 5 children. Two of her children are currently attending school.  

Marie runs a food stand within her community. She sells rice, palm oil, and cooking seasoning. She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business every day, 11 hours per day. She says that the main challenges to her business are a poor road network within her operation area and insufficient capital to operate her business.

Marie has requested a loan in order to buy rice, palm oil, pepper gallon oil, and cooking seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and take good care of her family. In the future, she plans to build a house and open a big shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, pepper gallon oil, and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
Zenobia tiene 50 años, esta casada con Emilio y tiene 5 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia construida a base de madera. Zenobia se dedica a cultivar cacao y otros productos de la zona junto a su esposo en un terreno agrícola de 2 hectáreas y media siendo este su principal sustento económico. Aprendió el oficio de la agricultura desde muy niña porque sus padres también se dedicaban a este oficio. Cuando alcanzó la mayoría de edad se casó y desde entonces trabaja al lado de su esposo con quien logró comprar el terreno que actualmente posee. Su principal objetivo desde el inicio de la campaña productiva es mantener en buen estado sus plantaciones de cacao orgánico y demás cultivos para llegar a la cosecha sin inconvenientes y vender sus productos para recuperar el dinero que invirtió con ganancias adicionales.  Para mejorar la calidad que suele obtener fertiliza sus suelos con abono orgánico. Suele también contratar a trabajadores del lugar quienes le ayudan a realizar las tareas del retiro de maleza y similares tareas que considera complicadas. Los productos que obtiene son comercializados en la ciudad donde están los principales compradores encargados de llevar los productos de la zona hasta las grandes fábricas de la capital. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante , además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
En esta ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Zenobia is 50 years old. She is married to Emilio and they have 5 children who live with them in a house they own, made out of wood. Zenobia makes a living growing cocoa and other products native to her region. Together with her husband, she works on a plot of land of 2.5 hectares that is their principal source of income. Zenobia learned how to farm when she was very young because her parents also made a living in this way. When she became an adult, she got married and since then has worked alongside her husband, who was able to buy the plot of land they now possess.

Zenobia's principal objective from the beginning of the planting season has been to keep her crops in good condition and in compliance with organic certification requirements. This way she will be able to harvest them without problems and sell the products to recover the money she invested plus some extra profit. In order to improve the quality of the harvests she used to have, Zenobia uses organic fertilizer on her soil. She also used to hire local workers who helped her to complete all of the labor of weeding and other tasks that can be overwhelming. She sells her crops in the city where there are buyers who work delivering products from her region to the big factories in the capital. 

This is Zenobia's first loan with Kiva and she is very grateful for the financial support she is receiving to get ahead. She also pledges to make all of her repayments punctually. Zenobia is requesting 2,000 Peruvian soles in order to buy organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Jariatu from the Lunsar Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with five children between the ages of three and 18 years, and has four additional dependents that live with her because they are relatives. In 2003, Jariatu established her building materials business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business every day, 12 hours per day. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Jariatu requires a loan in order to buy more building materials like cement, paint, and nails. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business so she can attract customers and improve her family's standard of living. In the future, Jariatu plans to import her goods and expand her business to an international standard. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more building materials like cement, paint, and nails

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Aminata, from Lunsar. She is married and has four children, between the ages of 8 and 18 years. Her children are currently going to school. Her husband's income is not enough to support the household. 

Aminata runs a general store, at her house. She sells items like soap, milk, pure water, soda and biscuits. She has been running this business since 1999. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night.  Aminata says that her major hardship is transporting her goods from her purchasing area to her shop.

Aminata has requested a loan in order to buy more things to resell at her store, including soap, milk, pure water, and drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and start a savings account. In the future, she plans to expand her shop more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more things to resell at her store, including soap, milk, pure water, and drinks.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria Tiene 49 años, es divorciada y tiene 5 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de material noble. Victoria se dedica a la agricultura en un terreno agrícola de 2 hectáreas que le heredó su padre y en donde tiene plantaciones de cacao y otros productos de pan llevar. Para obtener buenas ganancias a través de su trabajo debe obtener al termino de la campaña una buena calidad de sus frutos, es por ello que compra abono orgánico con frecuencia. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque lo considera muy tranquilo y puede recuperar el dinero que invirtió vendiendo sus productos a los acopiadores del lugar. Cuando llueve se complica su labor porque no puede desplazarse con normalidad entre sus parcelas por el lodo evitando que realice su trabajo con normalidad. Desde hace mucho tiempo desea dedicarse a la producción de café orgánico por poseer un buen precio en su localidad, es por ello que más adelante planea adquirir un parcela para dedicarse a la producción del mismo. Es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante con su negocio. En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Victoria is 49 years old, is divorced and has 5 children who live with her in her house which is constructed of quality material. Victoria makes her living in agriculture on 2 acres of farm land she inherited from her father where she has grows cocoa and other products that go in to making bread. To earn good profits from her work she needs to grow a good quality of her produce by the end of the season, which is why she frequently purchases organic fertilizer. 

She likes her work very much because she considers it very calm and she can recover the money invested by selling her products to the wholesalers in the area. When it rains it complicates her work because she cannot move around her land as easily because of the mud which prevents her from getting work done like normal. For a long time she has wished to start growing organic coffee which has a good price in her region. This is why she plans to acquire more land in the future to be devoted to growing coffee. 

This is her third loan with Kiva and she appreciates the financial support she receives to keep moving forward with her business. This time she is requesting 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to buy organic fertilizer to fertilize her farmland.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Susan

texts.es: Susan tiene 26 años, está casada y vive en una casa alquilada junto su esposo y su hija. Susan se dedica a la venta de calzados de segundo uso como zapatos y zapatillas de damas, caballeros y niños. Para eso cuenta con un local alquilado en una zona céntrica de la ciudad,. Su negocio es muy concurrido ya que los modelos que vende son novedosos y baratos. Se inició en esta labor hace 9 años y hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias económicas que obtiene. Se siente muy feliz con la actividad que realiza pues se siente útil y satisfecha, le está hiendo muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes. Espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará más mercadería conformado por calzados usados de damas y caballeros.
texts.en:
Susan is 26 years old and married, and she lives in a rented home with her husband and daughter. Susan works selling second-hand footwear, like shoes and trainers for women, men and children. She works out of a rented storefront in a central area of the city. Her business gets a lot of visitors given that she sells well-priced and modern styles of shoes.

She started this business nine years ago and has been running it alone up until now. She considers her business fairly profitable given the good earnings that she makes. She feels very happy with the work she is doing because she feels useful and satisfied, and it is going very well since she has a lot of customers. She hopes to have a bigger store where she can sell more comfortably.

On this occasion, she is asking for 1,500 soles [PEN]. She is grateful and happy to know that she can continue to count on the financial support she needs to continue progressing with her business. With the amount she is asking for, she will buy more merchandise, consisting of used women's and men's shoes.

loans.use: to buy more footwear merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: Ana de 34 años de edad se dedica a la venta de licuados desde hace 4 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el punto de buses de donde ella reside tiene mucha clientela especialmente los motoristas pues ellos son los que más le compran, con las ganancias que obtiene logra sacar adelante a su familia, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijo, Ana solicita un crédito para poder comprar todos los ingredientes necesarios como: azúcar, leche, guineos, fresas, vainilla, chocolate, etc. ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Ana, age 34, has sold shakes for four years. Her business is located the bus stop where she lives. She has many clients, especially motorists, who are her best customers. With her income she is able to get her family ahead. She lives in her own home with her husband and two children. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of all the necessary ingredients such as: sugar, milk, bananas, strawberries, vanilla, and chocolate. This is her only work and it will allow her to give her family what they need without limitation.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, bananas, strawberries, vanilla, chocolate, etc.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Rugiatu, from Lunsar. She is married and has six children between the ages of 8 and 23 years. One of them is in collage, and four are currently going to school.  

Rugiatu runs a bar and restaurant at her house; she sells stout, start beer and snacks. She has been running this business since 2010. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night.  Marie says that her business is going well, because she started with a small amount through BRAC.

Rugiatu has requested a loan in order to buy assorted drinks, like start beer, stout, and soft drinks, and to buy prepared foods for resale. The extra income from this loan will enable her to educate her children and expand her business. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy assorted hard and soft drinks, and prepared foods, to resell at her bar

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene 62 años, está casado y vive en su casa junto su esposa, su hija, y su nieto. José se dedica a la venta de bebidas de diversas marcas y sabores, productos  como galletas, caramelos, chicles y otros. Para esto cuenta con una pequeña tienda que logró en su propia casa por que siempre buscó generar sus propios ingresos económicos. Paralelamente se dedica al transporte público ya que cuenta con un automóvil de su propiedad. Empezó  con su negocio de ventas hace 2 años, tiempo que le sirvió para hacerse conocido entre sus vecinos y consolidar una buena clientela. Le gusta su actividad  pues le permite contar con los ingresos económicos que necesita para sostener su economía familiar. Tiene planes de incrementar el stock de sus productos y diversificar su variedad para así tener más acogida entre sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, agradece a todas las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de acceder al financiamiento que requiere para que continúe trabajando. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado mayor variedad de bebidas gasificadas y productos como chicles, galletas, caramelos y cereales.
texts.en:
José is 62 years old. He is married and lives with his wife, his daughter, and his grandson. José makes a living selling various brands and flavors of soft drinks, products such as cookies, caramels, gum, etc. He runs a tiny store that he built out of his home because he has always sought to create his own source of income. At the same time, he works in public transport and owns an automobile. José opened his store two years ago and, since then, has become well-known in his neighborhood so he has a steady customer base. He enjoys this work because it provides income he needs in order to provide for his family. José intends to increase his stock of products and offer more of a variety to better cater to his customers.

In this opportunity, José is requesting 1,000 Peruvian soles. He thanks everyone who has offered their support to offer him this opportunity to access a loan he needs to keep working. He also pledges to make all of his scheduled repayments. With this loan, José will increase the variety of soft drinks and products such as cookies, caramels, and cereal in his store.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and products like gum and cookies for his business.

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.es: Carlos de 33 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, él es muy conocido en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz, sopas,  entre otros, es muy dedicado a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que lo buscan y lo prefieren por sus productos. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco más la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que Carlos solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos,  producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, papel higiénico, detergentes, shampoo, medicinas,  etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y no tendrá más preocupación que llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en: Carlos, age 33, lives in his own home with his wife and daughter. He is very well-known in the area because of his humility and his dedication to his work. He has never given up and has always risen above his difficulties. With hard work and dedication, he has a store where he sells basic staples, milk, eggs, rice, soup, and other items. He is very dedicated to his work and provides good customer service. This is why he has a clientele who seek him out and prefer his store for his products. He has found it necessary to stock his store a bit more, given an increase in demand. He does not have the capital to do this. For this reason, Carlos is requesting a loan to buy more products such as basic staples, instant products, candy, drinks, toilet paper, detergent, shampoo, and medicines. He trusts God that this help will soon be authorized, and that he will only have to worry about providing his family with their daily bread.

loans.use: to buy basic staples, instant products, candy, drinks, toilet paper, detergent, shampoo, medicine, etc.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
La Señora María de 34 años, vive en su casa de habitación ubicada en un barrio de San Lorenzo en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 15 años a esta actividad que es la venta de pantalones, vestidos, blusas, faldas, ropa de niño entre otros.
Doña María sus cliente son amigos y vecinos que ella visita a diario en zonas aledañas a su comunidad, a sus clientes solo les va a dejar la mercadería.
Doña María es una señora muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de más mercadería como faldas, vestidos, blusas, camisas, calzonetas, etc. ya que su clientela le está pidiendo más mercadería.
Doña María con el apoyo de este préstamo  pretende suplir sus necesidades financieras, su sueño compra un carro para así poder surtir más su negocio.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2013.
texts.en:
Señora María, age 34, lives in her home in a neighbourhood of San Lorenzo, in the southern zone of Honduras. For almost 15 years she has sold pants, dresses, skirts, blouses, children's clothing, and other items.
Her clients are her friends and neighbours whom she visits daily in areas near to her community. She goes to drop off her merchandise.
María is a very hard-working woman with a desire to get ahead. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of more merchandise such as skirts, dresses, blouses, shirts, swim trunks, etc. Her customers are requesting more merchandise.
With the support of this loan, Maria plans to fill her financial needs. Her dream is to buy a car so that she can stock her business even more.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2013.

loans.use: to buy dresses, skirts, blouses, shirts, swim trunks, etc for her business.

loans.name: Raul Alfredo

texts.es: Raul de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el es un hombre responsable, trabajador y honrado, trabaja en su propia panadería en la que elabora pan dulce y pan francés, y sale a venderlo por las colonias de donde el reside, Raul está  solicitando un préstamo para invertir en la compra de harina, manteca, latas y todo lo necesario para poder producir más pan. Este proyecto de mejoramiento para su panadería es muy importante para él puesto que así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Raul, age 46, lives in his own home with his wife and two children. He is a responsible, hard-working and honest man. He works in his own bakery where he makes sweet bread and French bread. He goes out to sell it in the neighbourhoods near where he lives. Raul is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of flour, butter, tins, and everything necessary for producing more bread. This improvement project for his bakery is very important for him because this is how he will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, tins, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is 45 years old. He is married to Gina, who helps him to manage their farm. He has been growing rice for almost 20 years. His net income for the last cropping season was 20,000 PHP. 

Oscar is willing to work hard every single day to give his family a better life. He is currently requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his farm. He hopes that he can obtain his desired loan to improve and increase his income for the next cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Jelen

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jelen works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling MSE products. Jelen is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her buying and selling dry goods business.

Jelen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar tiene 57 años, está casado y vive en su casa propia a junto su esposa. Cesar se dedica a la venta de calzados como zapatos, zapatillas, sandalias, tiene para ofrecer a sus clientes productos nuevos y usados. Cuenta con un pequeño local alquilado en una zona comercial, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes. También ofrece el  servicio de reparación de calzados malogrados. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 7 años y considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tienen sus productos. Le gusta mucho su trabajo pues le permite contar con una ocupación e ingreso económico además de tener la libertad de poner su propio horario y días de trabajo. Espera en el futuro aumentar su capital y su stock de mercaderías para ver crecer su negocio. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1200, por tanto se siente agradecido con todas las personas que le brindan el préstamo que necesita para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará diversos calzados en variados modelos para damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
Cesar is 57 years old. He and his wife live in a house they own. Cesar makes a living selling footwear such as sneakers, heels, sandals, etc. He sells both new and used shoes. Cesar has a small shop that he rents in a commercial zone where he can kindly treat his customers. Cesar also repairs shoes.
He has been working in this business for seven years. He considers his business to be successful because of the demand that exists for his products. Cesar enjoys this work because he is employed and has a source of income. He also has the freedom to make his own schedule. He hopes that in the future he will increase his capital and stock so he can see his business grow.

Cesar is requesting a loan of 1,200 Peruvian soles. He is grateful to all of the people who take part in offering him this loan that he needs in order to reach his goals. He pledges to make his repayments punctually. With this loan, Cesar will buy a variety of shoes for women, men, and children.

loans.use: to buy various models of shoes for his store.

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en:
Batsaikhan, 31 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They reside in their own house on land that belongs to Batsaikhan's mother-in-law. Batsaikhan has been working as a driver for three consecutive years at a private company. His wife is a cook and currently works at a kindergarten kitchen. Their daughter goes to kindergarten. 

The interior components of their house are deteriorated. During wintertime, frost forms around the windows and wind seeps through the walls, which chills the family to their core. For this reason, Batsaikhan is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase insulating materials such as fiberglass, foam, and cotton. Using these materials, he can insulate the walls of the house with fiberglass and other items. As a result, the family won't need to burn a lot of coal for heating. Reducing the amount of coal they use will release fewer pollutants into the atmosphere and contribute to efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who is striving for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase insulation materials

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es: Aurelio de 49 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 5 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de madera. Aurelio es agricultor y se dedica a la producción de café desde hace 8 años en sus terrenos agrícolas, esta actividad la realiza junto a sus hijos mayores , aunque aveces contrata trabajadores del lugar para que lo apoyen con el retiro de maleza de sus cultivos. Su principal dificultad es al momento de llevar los granos de cafe recién cosechados para su respectivo secaso , pues indica que es muy cansado y en mas de una ocasión a sufrido caídas , pero considera que su esfuerzo vale la pena ya que puedo llevar dinero a su hogar. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. Desea en esta ocasión 1,000  nuevos soles para contratar trabajadores del lugar y avanzar con el retiro de maleza de sus cultivos.
texts.en: Aurelio, age 49, is single and has five children with whom he lives in his wooden house. Aurelio is a farmer and has cultivated coffee for eight years on his own land. He does this work with his two eldest children, though he sometimes hires local labourers to help him remove weeds. His main challenge comes when it is time to take the recently-harvested coffee out for drying. He says that he is very tired, and that on more than one occasion he has suffered falls. However, he thinks that his hard work is worth the effort because he is able to bring in an income for his household. This is his third loan on Kiva and he is grateful for the financial support that he receives to keep moving forward. He would like 1,000 soles to hire local labourers and move forward with weeding.

loans.use: to hire local labourers.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercializa en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; ella necesita invertir por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. Josefina tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Josefina lives with her partner and their two children in their own home. She cultivates corn and sorghum. Having worked for several years in agriculture, she has a great deal of experience which allows her to obtain the best harvests. She sells her crops in the community. She has many customers who prefer her business for the quality, good prices, and good service. She needs to invest, so she is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizer, manure, etc. Josefina has good payment references from those who know her. She is very responsible and assures us that she will be able to repay the loan as established. She is confident that this will bring economic security to her home.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizer, manure, etc.

loans.name: Joselle

texts.en:
Joselle, a 27-year-old mother of two children, both of whom are in school, has been earning a living by raising pigs in the Philippines for the past year. She earns additional income from raising ducks.

Joselle is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase more feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jumdah

texts.en:
Jumdah is 37 years old and married with four children.

Jumdah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF [Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation Inc.]  to buy additional items to sell, like sugar, shampoo, bread, eggs, groceries, etc.

Jumdah has borrowed and paid back 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Jumdah aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like sugar, shampoo, bread, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en:
Davaa, 47 years old, lives with her son and daughter in the Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband passed away recently and she is carrying the whole burden of raising her children alone. 

She has been working as a seamstress for more than 20 years, and she began working for a private company in 2003. However, she decided to quit her job when she realized that running a workshop on her own would be more profitable than working for someone else. Using her first Kiva loan, she purchased a sewing machine and began her own business.

Her business is doing well but she is currently experiencing a shortage of raw materials. She is therefore requesting a loan of 1,300,000 MNT to purchase leather in large quantities. This will help her to run her business smoothly without worrying about a shortage of raw materials. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who is striving for a better future.

loans.use: To purchase leather in large quantities.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Luis vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su esposa, el se dedica a la venta de agua de coco desde hace varios años vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias, tienen mucha clientela pues es un hombre muy amable, trabajador, honrado y honesto, por eso ha sabido ganarse a sus clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, luis está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar cocos por mayor y seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo, para poder darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Luis lives in his own home with his wife and three children. He has sold coconut water for several years, and sells on the streets in the various nearby neighbourhoods. He has many customers because he is a very kind, hard-working, honest and honourable man. With his income, he is able to cover some of the household costs. Luis is requesting a loan for the wholesale purchase of coconuts so that he can continue with his business; it is his only source of income for providing his family with greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy coconuts wholesale.

loans.name: Las Flores De Chiaj Group

texts.es:
La señora Candelaria de estado civil unida de hecho, tiene 38 años de edad, tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar 2 años de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos y 1 de ellos esta estudiando, se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos, inició este negocio con la ayuda de su madre y hasta la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de cerditos y concentrado para los mismos, espera en el futuro contar con un capital grande y su sueño es comercializar ganado. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedian a actividades pecuarias, comercio y artesanía.
texts.en:
Señora Candelaria is in a common law marriage. She is 38 and was able to go to school for two years. She has four children, one of whom is in school. She raises small animals, and started this business with the help of her mother. She currently has ten years' experience. Her husband, a merchant, helps her.
She has organized this group to request a loan which she will use for the purchase of hogs and hog feed. In the future she hopes to be able to have a large capital, and her dream is to sell livestock. The other group members work in livestock, commerce, and artistry.

loans.use: to buy young hogs.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz,  frijol y maicillo, vende sus productos en los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Maria esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, veneno para plagas, etc.  para seguir con su siembra ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Maria lives in her own home with her husband and three children. She grows corn, beans, and sorghum. She sells her products in the markets located near to her home. With her income, she is able to cover some household costs. Maria is requesting a loan for the purchase of necessary tools such as manure, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, etc. This will allow her to continue with her planting; this is her only source of income. This way, she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lilibeth works hard to support her family.  She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Lilibeth is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lolita works hard to support her family. She has a business selling fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and by raising pigs. Lolita is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy additional fish to sell at her fish-selling business.

Lolita has sustained her business activities through her past 19 loans with NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to achieve her dream of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 59 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lolita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Don juan de 60 años de edad,  vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, él se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y maicillo. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante varios años y es así como se gana el pan de cada día. Él es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy conocido en la zona por su enorme corazón y amabilidad para con los demás. Debido a que ya es temporada de siembra tomo la decisión de comenzar a prepararse. Es por esa razón que ha decidido solicitar este nuevo crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante y mejor que las anteriores, ya que esta es la forma en que él consigue el sustento para su familia.  Confía en Dios que con su ayuda, su dedicación y empeño en el  trabajo lograra el sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Juan, age 60, lives in his own home with his family. He works in agriculture, sowing corn and sorghum. He has done this for several years, and this is how he makes a living. He is a hard-working, responsible man who is very well-known in the area for his big heart and kindness to others. Because it is sowing season, he decided to start getting ready. For this reason, he has decided to request a new loan from Integral to invest in the purchase of seeds, manure, insecticides, fertilizer, herbicides, etc. What he most wants is for his harvest to be abundant and better than the previous ones; this is the only way he has to support his family. He trusts God that with His help and Juan's dedication and hard work, he will achieve his dream of improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, insecticides, fertilizer, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Gantugs

texts.en: Mr. Gantugs, 30 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. They reside in their own house on a plot of land. He has been rendering taxi service to local people for two years. His wife has been running clothes and jewelry sales for many years and now has maternity leave. Their two children stay at home. The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and it needs some serious repair. So he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, planks, metals, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, he will repair and insulate his house. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, thus releasing less pollutants into atmosphere and contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
This is Ursula, 48, a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Arnel, a driver, and she is a mother. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Ursula maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer, and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers earn as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business.

Ursula dreams of becoming successful in her business, and hopes to help her family financially. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship, and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies and merchandise: products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 60 years old and married with three children.

Lucia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like chips, canned goods, milk, rice, etc. 

Lucia has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years, and also earns an income from farming coconuts.

Lucia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase additional stock to sell like chips, canned goods, milk, rice, etc.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 62 years old, married and has six children, one of whom is in school.

Lucresia is in the pig fattening agricultural business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Lucresia has been pig fattening for three years, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lucresia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Luzel

texts.en:
Luzel is 30 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 30,000 PHP through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy additional items to sell, like charcoal, sugar, yakult [a probiotic milk product], rice, eggs, shampoo, and groceries.

Luzel has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs. 

Luzel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like charcoal, sugar, yakult, rice, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, ella se dedica  a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz y maicillo, vende sus productos en los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos que tiene en su casa, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar todos los insumos necesarios para seguir con su siembra como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. para tener un buena cosecha y asi poder seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: The client lives with her family in her own home. She is a farmer, and her main crops are corn and sorghum. She sells her products in the markets located near her home, and with her income she helps with the household costs. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of all the necessary supplies to continue with her crops, such as: fertilizer, manure, seeds, herbicides, etc. This will allow her to have a good harvest and to be able to continue helping with the household costs without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, seeds, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Santos Humberto

texts.es:
El señor  santos de 35 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 02 hijos quienes viven en su casa de habitación, ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, Nacaome  al sur de Honduras.
Don Santos se  dedica a su actividad que es la venta de arroz, frijoles, carne, huevos, pollo etc. sus clientes son los vecinos de la  aldea donde vive. 
Don Santos está solicitando el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, frijoles, huevos, harinas, azúcar, café, queso, leche, salsas, pastas, etc. que son los productos que tiene para la venta.
Don Santos con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende seguir invirtiendo más en su negocio y seguir creciendo, su sueño es poder ir mejorando más su casa de habitación.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2013
texts.en:
Don Santos is 35 and lives with his wife and two children in the family's home in the small town of San Lorenzo, Nacaome in southern Honduras. 

Don Santos sells rice, beans, meat, eggs, chicken, and other foods. His customers are neighbors in the community. Don Santos is requesting a loan to purchase goods such as rice, beans, eggs, flour, sugar, coffee, cheese, milk, sauces, pasta, and other foods that he sells. 

Don Santos will use the funds from this loan to continue investing more in his business so it will continue to grow. His ambition is to be able to keep improving his home. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2013

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, eggs, flour, sugar, coffee, cheese, milk, sauces, pastas, and other foods for his business.

loans.name: Mirna Leonor

texts.es: Mirna de 31 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz y el maicillo, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; Mirna necesita invertir por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, fertilizantes, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde siembra ya que donde ella reside los terrenos son rústicos y pedregosos para seguir con sus siembras y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mirna, age 31, works in agriculture. Her main crops are corn and sorghum. She sells her products around her community, and has a large clientele who prefer her business for the quality, good prices, and, above all, the good service. Mirna needs to invest, so she is requesting a loan which will allow her to buy seeds, insecticide, herbicides, fertilizer, etc, and to improve her farmland. Where she lives, the land is coarse and stony; with this loan she will be able to continue with her crops and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Luong

texts.en:
Luong is 63 years old. She has three children who are married. She and her husband cook breakfast to sell. They earn about 3,500,000 VND each month per person. She has done this job for 22 years. Her family’s total income is about 7,000,000VND per month. Luong’s challenges in life and work are lacking capital to expand her business area. Her dream is to build a bigger and cleaner restaurant. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach this dream. She can invest in breeding chickens to gain earnings and save the profit for her dream. Luong is a hardworking and careful woman. 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In her last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,288,000 VND. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy more chickens to breed.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to breed.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
This is Judith, 30, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Marlon, a tricycle driver, and she is the mother of their children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Judith oversees and owns the operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business, the regular customers are the local community. She also has a tailoring business for additional income. She earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 9,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle.

Judith dreams of expanding her business and hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal for her buy and sell charcoal business.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 41 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling purified water in the Philippines, and requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to purchase additional equipment for her business.

Merlita has borrowed and paid back eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business selling purified water for five years, and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

Merlita aspires to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for her business.

loans.name: Mydee

texts.en:
Mydee is 28 years old and married with three children, who are in school.

Mydee works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like sugar, rice, eggs, vinegar, groceries, etc. to sell.

Mydee has borrowed and paid back seventeen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Mydee aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like sugar, rice, eggs, vinegar, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nor-In

texts.en:
Nor-In is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her buy and sell dried coconut meat business.

Nor-In has been in this business for six years. Nor-In earns more income from buy and sell vegetables.

Nor-In has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: Caciano

texts.es: Caciano tiene 29 años y es padre soltero de una niña de 4 años con quien vive en su casa propia. Caciano es un agricultor conocido de la zona y desempeña su producción de cacao de manera dinámica ya que cuenta con terreno propio para desempeñar está actividad. Además contrata trabajadores del lugar para la producción en época de mantenimiento y cosecha , le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que puede obtener muy buenas ganancias , lo único que lo desmotiva en ocasiones es el tranporte de sus sacos de cacao hacia la parte baja de su localidad ya que el terreno es muy inclinado y eso le genera un costo adicional en transporte, el propone que la mejor manera de contrarrestarlo es sembrando cacao en la parte de su terreno para así facilitar el transporte, pero para esto necesita dinero ya que debe comprar abono orgánico y plantas de cacao. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico al por mayor.
texts.en:
Caciano, age 29, is a single father. He lives with his four-year-old daughter in his own home. He is a well-known farmer in the area, and cultivates cocoa dynamically. He has his own land for this activity. He hires local labourers during the seasons where maintenance is required, and for harvesting. He enjoys his work a great deal because he is able to make a very good income. The only thing that discourages him at times is transporting sacs of his cocoa to the lower area of his locality, because the land is very sloped and this generates additional transportation costs. He thinks that the best way to get around this is to sow cocoa on the lower part of his land in order to facilitate transportation, but in order to do so he needs money to buy organic fertilizer and cocoa plants.
This is his third loan on Kiva, and he is grateful for this financial support in getting ahead. He also promises to repay his quotas punctually. He would like to have 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase organic fertilizer wholesale.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Cesar Edgardo

texts.es: Cesar vive con su familia que está conformada por su esposa, sus dos hijos, sus dos nueras  y dos nietos en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y hortalizas desde hace varios años vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene y con ayuda de sus dos hijos logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,  cesar está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios para poder seguir con sus cosechas como: abonos, herbicidas, semillas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. y así poder tener una mejor cosecha para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Cesar lives with his family-- his wife, two sons, two daughters-in-law, and two grandchildren-- in his own home. He has cultivated corn, beans, and vegetables for several years. He sells his produce in the various markets near to his home. With his income and the help of his two sons, he is able to cover some household costs. Cesar is requesting a loan for the purchase of the necessary supplies for continuing with his crops, such as: manure, herbicides, seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, etc. This way he will be able to have a better harvest and give his family greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, herbicides, seeds, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and different ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Edita

texts.es:
Edita tiene 30 años, está casada y tiene 02 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia construida a base de adobe. Edita se dedica a la agricultura,  siempre está en su terreno agrícola viendo la producción de sus cultivos de cacao. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de trabajadores del lugar, quienes le ayudan a extraer de forma rápida los frutos de cacao. Su cosecha es llevada a los compradores de su localidad; quienes le pagan muy bien por los granos de cacao. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Desea en esta ocasión contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico para así nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Edita is 30 years old and married. She has two children, and they live together in a house built from adobe (a natural building material). Edita works in agriculture, and she is always on her agricultural plot overseeing the production of her cocoa crops. During the harvest, she counts on the support of local workers, who help her to harvest the cocoa fruits quickly. Her harvest is taken to the buyers in her community, who pay her very well for her cocoa beans.

This is her first loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support to keep moving forward. Furthermore, she is committed to making her payments in a punctual manner.

She is asking for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy organic manure to provide nutrients to her crops.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija de 12 años de edad, el posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, sopas, aceite, café, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas lo prefieren y lo mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, francisco quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. para poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco lives in his own home with his wife and their 12-year-old daughter. He owns a convenience store where he sells staple grains, milk, eggs, soups, oil, coffee, and other goods. Francisco has run his store for many years, gaining sales experience that has allowed him to earn higher income. 

Francisco's store is located in the family's home and has many loyal customers that make it the most successful shop in the area. The store offers the greatest variety of high-quality goods at reasonable prices and with unbeatable service to customers day and night. Francisco hopes to grow the business and make new investments, but needs capital. He therefore requested a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to purchase staple grains, snacks, eggs, bread, drinks, and other goods and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use:
comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. 

to purchase staple grains, snacks, eggs, bread, drinks, and other goods.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан упорный в достижении цели, усердный и предприимчивый человек. Ему 29 лет, имеет жену и четверых детей. Он с женой, детьми, матерью и братьями проживает в районе Хуросон. Хасан подзарабатывает таксистом, а его семья занимается сельским хозяйством. Чтобы улучшить условия финансового положение семьи Хасан решил заняться бизнесом. Он возле своего дома построил помещение для продуктового магазина и оснастил его необходимыми принадлежностями. Теперь ему необходимо закупить продукты питания для того чтобы начать продажу. У него в руках осталось немного сбережения, но этого недостаточно. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом. На сумму кредита и сбережения он хочет приобрести разнообразный ассортимент продуктов питания. Ему в бизнесе будут помогать его младшие братья. Хасан очень надеется на вашу поддержку в реализации его цели!
texts.en: Hasan is a goal-oriented, hard-working and enterprising person. He is 29 years old, is married and has four children. He lives with his wife, children, mother and brothers in the Khuroson region. Hasan earns some money on the side as a taxi driver, and his family works in agriculture. In order to improve his family’s financial situation, Hasan decided to launch a business. He has build a shed for a grocery store next to his home and bought the necessary equipment. Now he needs to stock up on food items in order to start selling. He has some savings left, but this is not enough. This is why he has applied for a loan. He will use the loan and his savings to buy a wide variety of food items. His younger brothers will help him in the business. Hasan is really hoping for your support in achieving his goal.

loans.use: to stock up on food items in order to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Guillermo Enrique

texts.es: Don Guillermo, quien trabaja día y noche para mantener su hogar, es un padre responsable, cinco de sus seis hijos ya son mayores de edad e independientes, solamente una vive con ellos, su esposa es ama de casa y se encarga del orden del hogar. Don Guillermo está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en mejoras de su vivienda, necesita levantar una pared para hacer un cuarto y mejorar el piso de su casa, los cuales hará el con sus propias manos con material liviano, siendo este su trabajo principal con el que se gana la vida desde hace muchos años.
texts.en: Guillermo works day and night to maintain his home. He is a responsible father. Five of his six children are older in age and independent. Only one child lives at home. His wife is a housewife and takes care of the house. Guillermo is requesting a loan to invest in house improvements. He needs to build a wall to make a room and to improve the house’s floor.  He will build these with his own hands with lightweight materials. This has been his main work for many years.

loans.use: purchase plycem, cement, sand, wood and zinc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde 10 años y eso le ha dado el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, almacena sus productos en sacos así como muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos a los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, vive con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijas en casa propia, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, semillas, venenos para plagas, etc. y poder seguir con sus cultivos para darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: The client has been a farmer for ten years, and this has given him the necessary knowledge to care for his crops. His main crops are corn and beans. He stores his products in bags, as seen in the photograph, to later to out and sell them in the various markets near his home. He lives with his partner and their two daughters in their own home. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of manure, fertilizer, herbicides, seeds, pesticides, etc. so that he can continue with his crops in order to give his family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Eda Estela

texts.es:
La señora Eda Estela de 62 años de edad es madre soltera, vive con un  nieto en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 07  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería.
Doña Eda Estela su negocio está ubicado en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, en su negocio ella vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar.
Doña Eda Estela es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante, vende de todo y gracias a su actividad ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y ahora mantiene una nieta, es un ejemplo de trabajo y dedicación.
Doña Eda Estela está solicitando el préstamo para compra de pollo, dulces, churros, refrescos, frijoles, azúcar, arroz, café, pan, mantequilla, queso, leche, etc. con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar su ingreso y salir adelante.
Doña Eda Estela está muy contenta de poder trabajar  con Prisma,  es su primer crédito que solicita, su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio  del 2013.
texts.en:
Eda Estela, age 62, is a single mother. She lives with one grandchild in her home. For seven years, she has had a grocery store.
