Her business is located in a community of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. She sells all household grocery items.
Eda Estela is a hard-working and very enterprising woman with a desire to get ahead and sell a lot. Thanks to her business, she has been able to get her children ahead. She now cares for one granddaughter. She is a shining example of work and dedication.
Eda Estela is requesting a loan for the purchase of chicken, candy, churros, pop, beans, sugar, rice, coffee, bread, butter, cheese, milk, etc. With this loan, she plans to improve her income and get ahead.
Eda Estela is very happy to be able to work with Prisma. This is her first loan. Her dream is to improve her business and her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2013.

loans.use: to buy chicken, candy, churros, pop, beans, sugar, rice, coffee, bread, butter, cheese, milk, etc.

loans.name: Gyulizar

texts.en:
Gyulizar is a teacher with many years of experience teaching in the local school. She lives in a small city called Tsamaqasar, in the Aragatsotn region. Unfortunately, a teacher’s salary is not enough to make ends meet for a family of four: Gyulizar's husband, two children, and Gyulizar herself. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but a farm business helps the family have some stable income. 

Both Gyulizar and her husband are involved in their small farm and, for a start, they already have some livestock (5 cows and 3 bulls). Now, in order to tackle their financial difficulties, Gyulizar wants to enlarge her farm. She has requested this loan with which she plans to purchase three oxen, three piglets, and food for feeding them. The loan will significantly increase her family's income. It is obvious that the family's financial needs are significant, but Gyulizar and her husband work hard to solve them and give their children a better life. 

They wait for your support!

loans.use: to pay for three oxen and three piglets as well as food for feeding them

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y ha ganado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefieren porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un buen servicio; Roberto  es un hombre activo, entregado a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta buscando oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, piensa trabajar con esfuerzo y constancia para no rendirse en el camino; en las ultimas cosechas tuvo muchos problemas y perdidas y desea recuperarse, hará una nueva inversión que le permita aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abono, insecticida, herramientas fertilizantes, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía ya que los terrenos donde el reside son rústicos y pedregosos, y así seguir con sus cosechas para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Roberto lives in his own home with his wife and daughter. He cultivates corn and beans and has worked in agriculture for several years. He has gained valuable experience that allows him to obtain the best harvests. He sells throughout the community and has built up a large clientele who prefer his produce because everything he sells is top quality, at accessible prices and with good service. Roberto is an active man, dedicated to his work, and has a great desire to get ahead. He is always looking for opportunities to succeed. He plans to work earnestly and constantly in order to succeed. In his most recent harvests he had many problems and losses, and he wants to recuperate. He will make a new investment which will allow him to increase his production. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Integral which will allow him to buy seeds, manure, insecticides, tools, fertilizers, etc. and to improve his farmland, shown in the photograph. The land in the area where he lives is very stony and coarse. With this investment, he will be able to continue with his crops in order to give his family greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, insecticide, tools, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes Mariela

texts.es: Mercedes  de treinta y siete años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa de un familiar con su hijo de 10 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al gusto de los clientes; mercedes es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora, día con día se esfuerza al máximo para ganarse una vida mejor, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Mercedes asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Mercedes, age 37, is a single mother. She lives in the home of a family member with her 10-year-old child. She has sold clothing for several years and has gained a lot of experience which allows her to make better earnings. Her business is located in her home. She has built up a strong clientele because people know that all of her products are quality, at accessible prices, and with unrivalled service. She is always ready to serve her clients. Mercedes is a very enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work and very hard-working. Every day she works as hard as she can to create a better life for herself. In the last few weeks demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of this and make a new investment, but she does not have sufficient capital. This is why she is requesting a loan from Integral. It will allow her to buy clothing wholesale. Mercedes assures us that she will be able to clear the debt,  and she also hopes that this loan will bring economic stability to her home.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta es madre soltera vive con sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa: faldas, blusas, pantalones, camisas, etc.  desde hace varios años, tienen mucha clientela pues vende la mercadería a buen precio,  con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería por mayor y poder seguir con su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a sus hijos una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: The borrower is a single mother. She lives in a house of her own with her two children. She has been selling clothes, such as skirts, blouses, trousers, shirts, etc., for several years. Her good prices attract a large number of customers. With the profits, she is able to face some of the household's expenses. The borrower asks for a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale, in order to keep on with her business and increase her income, so as to offer her children greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Don Oscar de 57 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y su  hija, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocido en la zona y ya tiene buena clientela pues obtiene las mejores cosechas, por lo tanto comercia producto de primera calidad y a precios muy accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable, él se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad, es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, piensa que aprovechar las oportunidades lo llevaran un paso más adelante del éxito; don Oscar quiere aumentar la producción, pero necesita de un apoyo de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, venenos para plagas, etc. asi como muestra la fotografía . Don Oscar tiene referencias de tener una moral intachable, responsable y de muy buena paga, confía que podrá responder a la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Oscar, age 57, lives with his wife and daughter. He cultivates corn and beans. He has been farming for many years, so he has built up a great deal of experience in the area. He is very well-known in his neighbourhood and has a good customer base because he has the best harvests and therefore sells products of the highest quality and at very accessible prices. What's more, his service is unrivalled. He is known for his great kindness. He is an enterprising man with a great desire to get ahead. He thinks that taking advantage of opportunities will bring him one step closer to success. Oscar wants to increase his production, but he needs capital. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Integral which will allow him to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, etc, as shown in the photo. 
Oscar has references that say that he is of faultless character, responsible, and pays off his debts. He is confident that he will be able to repay the loan, and that he will be able to give his family a good life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Hoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Hoeurn is a grocery store owner, aged 52, residing in Sa Ang district of Kandal province. She has four children, and a daughter is helping her with business and household chores. From the current business, she is able to earn up to 16,700 KHR per day.

This is the first loan for Hoeurn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She leads a group of two, to apply for a new loan. Hoeurn will spend her loan portion, in the amount of 800,000 KHR, to buy more grocery items to resell, and to buy materials to be used to fix her children's motorbike. She hopes this deal will replenish her grocery shop on time, and she will get back a good income.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to resell, and to buy materials to be used to fix her children's motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy basic staples, meat, chicken, pastries, and dairy products.

loans.name: Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
La señora Sebastiana esta casada, cuenta con 38 años de edad, cursó 4 años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes y guipiles típicos, inició este negocio con la ayuda de su esposo y hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de hilos para tejer guipiles y cortes, espera en el futuro tener un local fijo en el mercado del municipio donde pueda vender sus tejidos: Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a tejeduría, tienda de artículos de consumo diario y actividades pecuarias.
texts.en:
Señora Sebastiana is 38 and married. She has four years of elementary education. She has three children, two of whom are in school. She knits traditional cortes [clothing or cloth] and guipiles [blouses or dresses]. She started this business with the help of her husband, and currently has seven years' experience.
She has organized a group in order to be able to request a loan which she will use for the purchase of yarn so that she can knit guipiles and cortes. In the future she hopes to have a fixed stall in the municipal market where she will be able to sell her products.
The other group members knit, sell basic staples, and work in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy yarn for knitting.

loans.name: Replita

texts.en:
Replita is 56 years old, married, and has one child. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for 33 years, and she earns additional income from a general store ("sari-sari," in the Philippines).

Replita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan, to build her vegetable farming and general store business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years, and she earns additional income by raising pigs, farming coconut, and buying and selling dried coconut.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for the foods she will prepare and sell. Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her prepared food business

loans.name: Seenimi Group

texts.fr:
Mme A.SAFIATA CNIHISSIPOMG est responsable du groupe SEENIMI.  Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 26ans et le moins âgés à 12 ans.  02 vont à l’école  et  elle a 04 personnes en charge. 
Mme fait la restauration et vend aussi l’eau glacée depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes. 
Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de riz, 02 bidons d’huile et 01 sac de maïs. 
Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices afin de renforcer son restaurant. Mme ambitionne toujours étendre les limites de son activité et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs. A. Safiata Chinissipomg is the leader of the Seenimi group. She is doing well. She is married and  the mother of four. The eldest is 26 years old, and the youngest is 12. Two of her children attend school; she has four dependents. She has been cooking food for sale and also selling iced water for three years. She stocks up at her local market. Her customers are both men and women. She would like to buy two bags of rice, two jugs of vegetable oil and one bag of corn. She would like to save her revenues in order to bolster her business. She always tries to expand her business so as to better provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy two bags of rice, two jugs of vegetable oil and one bag of corn.

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Chorn, a citizen from Moung Russey district in Battambang province, is 51 years old and the mother of nine children. Currently, only one of her kids is still in school. She strives for a living by rice farming on a five and one-half hectare area of land. Having worked at this occupation for ages, she is able to earn up to 32,000 KHR per day.

Chorn has never before borrowed with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she is seeking a 2,000,000 KHR loan.  She will use it to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She highly believes that she can reap a good yield from her cash crop, and make a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for rice farming

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
This is Janice, 29, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Joven, a construction worker, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household, while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Janice operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go, to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales, every day.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan, to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages, to expand her product inventory.

Janice dreams of expanding her business.  She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for items to resell at her store, including groceries, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon works hard to support her family. She is married. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, a business in which she has been engaged for three years.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.  She will use the loan to buy additional stock to sell. Corazon would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Jaimer

texts.es: Jaimer  tiene 42 años, esta casado con Ernestina y tiene 2 hijas con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de madera. Jaimer se dedica a la producción de cacao en sus terrenos de cultivo cuya actividad es su principal fuente de ingresos económicos. En esta última temporada de cosecha varias plagas afectaron sus plantaciones de cacao y esto no le permitió obtener muy buenas ganancias, el considera que la mejor manera de hacer frente a esta plaga en  muchos casos  es reemplazando las plantaciones y supervisando constantemente sus cultivos, pues para ello será necesario contratar trabajadores del lugar y comprar de abono  orgánico, ya que esto permitirá que sus cultivos esten en óptimas condiciones. Uno de sus principales objetivos es comprar un vehículo para el transporte de sus productos. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar 2,000 nuevos soles  para la  compra de abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Jaimer, 42, is married to Ernestina and he has 2 daughters.  He lives with his family in his house, which is made of wood.  Jaimer is a farmer who cultivates cocoa on his farmlands.  This activity is his main source of income.  During the last harvest season various pests affected his cocoa crops, and this prevented him from getting very good earnings.  He thinks that the best way to deal with this pest, in most cases, is to replace the plants and constantly monitor the crops.  To do this, it will be necessary for him to hire workers from the area and also buy organic fertilizers, since this will allow him to keep his crops in optimal condition.  

One of Jaimer's main goals is to buy a vehicle to transport his products.  This is his 4th loan with Kiva, and he is grateful for the financial support that he is receiving so that he can continue forward.  Also, he promises to make his payments on time.  At this time, he wants to borrow 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy organic fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. She is married. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, a business in which she has engaged for 6 years, now.

Virginia requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy a sewing machine and additional materials for her business, like cloth, needles and thread. Virginia would like to save money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and additional materials for her business, like cloth, needles and thread

loans.name: Dezelyn

texts.en:
This is Dezelyn. Her previous loan helped her not just in her business but also in the education of her children and their household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Dezelyn dreams to expand her business. She also wants to have a canteen. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en: Adela is 56 years old.  She is married and has three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Adela is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her animals.  Adela has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Sokchea's Group

texts.en:
Sokchea, age 24, is the only breadwinner in her family, which is comprised of herself and one child. She resides in Cheung Prey district, Kampong Cham province, where she is engaged in rice farming. She has been farming for several years.

This is the first loan for Sokchea with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now she is in a group of two, applying for a new loan, and she is the group leader. Sokchea will spend her loan portion on plowing fee, potash fertilizer, and buying rice seed. She hopes that this purchase will enable her to grow her crop seasonably and earn a good income, to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy potash and rice seed, and to pay the plowing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Heang, 37, is a single lady who makes a living via rice cropping as the main source of income.  She has been farming since she was 20 years and now is able to earn up to 28,600 KHR per day. Heang is seeking for the first loan with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) in order to buy potash and rice seed for her farm. She hopes that she can support her business promptly and make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy potash and rice seed for her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina, who is now 48 years of age, is separated and has one child. She is grateful, because despite her situation as a single parent, still she is able to manage well her retail store business, for the welfare of her child. Aside from her variety store, she is engaged in hog-raising, wherein she raises two fattening pigs. 

She has been doing the retailing business for nine years, with determination toward continuous improvement of her family life. Aquilina is requesting to borrow additional capital of PHP 7,000.  This loan capital will allow her to buy necessary merchandise, such as assorted biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil and canned goods. She believes that through this loan, she can further get ahead of life and somehow attain financial stability.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to resell at her store, such as assorted biscuits ,soft drinks, cooking oil and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, tomatoes, chickens, vegetables, vegetable leaves to wrap tamales, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus hijos, es muy conocida en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz, huevos,  entre otros, es muy dedicada a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que la buscan y la prefieren por sus productos. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco mas la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que la clienta solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y no tendrá más preocupación que llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en:
The client lives in her own house with her life partner and children. She is very well-known in the area where she lives for her humility and dedication to her work. She has never stopped overcoming and has always moved forward from her difficulties. 

With effort and dedication, she has a store in which she sells staple products: bulk grains, milk, eggs and rice, among others. She is very dedicated to her work and very helpful with selling. Because of this, she has clients who look for her and prefer her for her products. 

She has seen the need to fill the store a little more due to the increase in demand, and she does not have the capital to achieve this. This is why the client is asking for a loan, to buy more products like bulk grains, instant products, candies, drinks, etc. She trusts God that the help she requests will soon be granted, and she will have no more worries than bringing home a daily livelihood.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, instant products, candies, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Jerramay

texts.en:
Jerramay is 31 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are in school. 

She is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Jerramay requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs. Jerramay has been in pig fattening for ten years, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Jerramay would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 51 years old, married, and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines; she has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Letecia has been raising pigs for 20 years, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 47, is a married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Josephine has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Josephine has been in this business for two years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 59 years old and married.  She has five years of experience in hog-raising. This business has enabled her to provide for all of her children's needs as they were growing up. 

At her age, Esmeralda is determined to work harder so their living conditions will improve. 

Esmeralda is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 to buy a supply of hog feed and vaccines for her pigs. 

She dreams of seeing her business grow towards economic stability and to obtain a quality life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Doña francisca vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos; ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y hortalizas, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, ella comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, doña francisca necesita invertir en insumos pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc. doña francisca  tiene buenas referencias de pago y está segura que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Francisca lives together with her husband and her two children. She makes her living in agriculture, specifically in growing corn and vegetables. She has many years of work in this area, and it has given her a very valuable experience which has allowed her to obtain better crops. Her crop land is located in am agricultural area, and she sells in all the surrounding areas. 

She already has many regular clients. These people always prefer her products because they are of quality and at truly affordable prices; also, the service is unmatched. 

Francisca needs to invest in inputs, but she needs capital. Because of this, she is asking Apoyo Integral for a loan which will allow her to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc. Francisca has good payment references and is sure she can pay off her debt in time, and is also confident that she can give her family the quality of live they deserve.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc.

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en:
Yat, 63, is originally from the Sa Ang district  of Kandal province. She struggles for daily food consumption, and she grows rice and garlic as her main sources of income. 

Yat has been with VisionFund for ages. This is the fourth cycle for Yat with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan with success. The positive impact of her past loan has enabled to relieve her family's burden better than before. 

For this cycle, she has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan.  As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy good seeds for planting, and buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops. 

She highly believes that she can make good progress of her business so that she can increase her income to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To buy good seeds for planting, and fertilizer and insecticide for her crops

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con su familia, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en la que vende refrescos, golosinas, dulce y otra serie de artículos comestibles y no comestibles; a través de este comercio ayuda en los gastos de su casa. Ella busca mejorar su calidad  de  vida y la de su familia,  por lo que solicita un crédito para incrementar la variedad de sus  artículos en su tienda, como: granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, aceite, azúcar, café, sopas, etc.  lo que le permitiría incrementar las ganancias de  su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
The client lives in her own house with her family.  She has a small store where she sells soft drinks, candy, sweets, and other edible and non-edible products.  It is through this business that she helps with her household expenses.

She is looking to improve the quality of her life and that of her family.  That is why she is requesting a loan in order to increase the variety of items in her store.  She will buy things like basic grains, soft drinks, candy, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, and soup, etc.  This will allow her to increase the earnings from her business and to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soft drinks, candy, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, and soup, etc.

loans.name: Larena

texts.en:
Larena works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Larena requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Larena has been in this business for ten years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Sumaira's Group

texts.en:
Sumaira lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 2 children. Her husband owns a garment shop which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of garments in his shop. Presently he is interested in purchasing garments for the summer season. However due to financial constraints he finds it difficult to do so.

Therefore Sumaira, as a member of two persons lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase garments for her husband's shop. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for the business. She wants to start savings from the profit so that in the future she will not face any financial problems.

loans.use: to purchase variety of garments for the summer season.

loans.name: Nory's Group

texts.en:
Nory, a dweller from Sa Ang district of Kandal Province, is 38 years old and a mother of three children. Currently, only one child is in school, while the remaining two are working at the local factory to help the family. 

The main sources of Nory's income are from ginger planting and rice cropping, which she has been engaged in since she was 20 years old. Now, she is able to earn about KHR 25,000 per day. 

This is not the first loan for VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan with success and it has enabled her to promptly support her business and upgrade her lifestyle, one step ahead. 

Now, in a group of four, she is the leader. Nory and two other fellow group members are seeking KHR 1,000,000 each, while a remaining member is applying for KHR 800,000. 

For Nory, who leads this group, she will spend her loan portion to buy good ginger seedlings and fragrant rice seeds for replanting. Moreover, she will use a portion of it to buy potash to boost her cash-crop productivity. 

She hopes that this purchase will help her to grow her crops on-time and produce a good yield.

loans.use: to buy good ginger seedlings and fragrant rice seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose Luis, originally from Mexico, started renting moon bounces in late 2012 with his own funds, and currently has five bounces. (For more information about this emerging business, please visit his website: mydreambounce.com.) MD Dream Jump is a bonded, licensed and insured company, renting bounces to different families and kids’ parties across the greater Washington area. Since this business demands time mainly during the weekend, Jose Luis is currently maintaining his full-time job, but he is looking forward to being full-time focused in developing MD Dream Jump. MD Dream Jump is requesting a $6,000 loan to improve the product offering and increase the business revenues with the following acquisitions: Two additional bounces, to satisfy the increasing demand and to add more variety, since many prospective clients are asking for “cars- and Rangers-themed bounces” for older boys. Currently, he carries only Disney-themed bounces. Chairs and tables to rent, since clients are permanently asking. This will add value (convenience) to the current business offering and will generate some marginal income as well. He is planning to buy chairs and tables.

loans.use: to buy two additional bounces and also chairs and tables.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima moved to the United States from Sudan in search of more opportunities for her family. Running a small business in Sudan, she sold local clothing and grocery items. However, despite her hard work, there never seemed to be enough money to provide her four children with the education and opportunities she wanted to give them.

In 2004, she settled in a Sudanese immigrant community in San Diego. The transition was difficult for Halima. “I had no bank account and no credit. It was overwhelming,” she shared.  “But I am a businesswoman, and have always been a businesswoman.  I knew I had to try.” 

A friend in the community had heard of Accion San Diego, a local non-profit microlender, and encouraged Halima to apply for a loan. With her Accion loan she opened an African clothing business, but it struggled and Halima was forced to close. Despite this hardship, Halima faithfully paid off her loan and was determined to figure out another way to make it.

Despite not having a storefront, Halima sold ice cream, sodas and yogurt at church events. She constantly looked for other ways to feed her entrepreneurial spirit. “I have so many ideas for businesses,” Halima shared, laughing. She soon realized that immigrants yearn for the clothing, jewelry and other reminders of Africa, and that there is little competition in her area. As word has spread about the store, Halima has received numerous requests for specific cherished African items from excited friends and neighbors. 

Halima will use her Kiva loan of $7,000 to purchase inventory, including African clothing, jewelry and convenience items for her new store. As she grows, she plans to add staff and offer more African items, including food. 

Halima encourages other entrepreneurs. “If there's something in your heart, you need to keep trying.”

loans.use: to purchase inventory, including African clothing, jewelry and convenience items

loans.name: Charlton

texts.en:
Charlton believed early on that he would have a career in drafting, and after high school he tried to enroll in a drafting course at Houston’s Technical Institute. However, the class was full, and fate led him to sign up for a class in the “electrical trades.” The class was very hands-on from the first day, and Charlton discovered that he loved working with circuit boards. This experience began Charlton’s lifelong passion for electronics. He went on to have a 33-year career working for power companies like Dyna Electric and the San Onofre power plant. 

With the most recent recession, Charlton struggled as there was little work for electricians. In an effort to reinvent himself, Charlton took marketing and drafting classes at a San Diego community college. He also set up a cleaning business, but found the hours grueling and the work unrewarding. 

Charlton finally chose to return to the trade that he deeply values. In 2009, rather than seeking employment, he decided to take control of his own destiny and obtained his independent contractor license. He started Light Duty Electric, an electrical services business in Oceanside, California, and as the construction industry began to recover, business quickly picked up.  

Currently, Charlton works 14 to 16 hours a day and takes pride in the skills he has honed. He has a reputation as an honest and skilled electrician. Charlton commits to providing customers with quality electrical work and to paying vendors in a timely manner. As his business grows, he plans to use his Kiva loan to pay for electrical materials and to help maintain a consistent cash flow.

His dream is to eventually be able to grow his business to the point where he can hire employees and purchase additional trucks, passing on both his expert skill and excellent work ethic.

loans.use: to pay for electrical materials and to help maintain a consistent cash flow.

loans.name: Juver Adalberto

texts.es: Juver de 39 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el tiene un ferretería en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años tiene mucha clientela ya que sus productos son de muy buena calidad y a precios accesibles, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Juver está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar estantes, vitrinas, clavos, lámparas, focos, tornillos, etc. y todo lo necesario  para poder surtir su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Juver, age 39, lives with his wife and their two children.  He has had a hardware store in his home for several years.  He has a lot of clientele because his products are very good quality at affordable prices.  With the earnings that he gets he manages to pay some of the household expenses.

Juver is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy shelves, display cases, nails, light bulbs, flashlights, screws, and everything he needs to be able to stock his business.  He will do this to get better earnings in order to give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy shelves, display cases, nails, light bulbs, flashlights, and screws, etc.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She sells fruits, vegetables, pumpkins and cereals in Kangundo town. She has been in this business for 4 years and it has been profitable. This will be her third loan and she plans to use the money to buy more stock of vegetables, oranges, lemons and cereals such as beans and maize for sale. She will use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to grow her business and open a grocery stall; this will allow her to sell more varieties of groceries and hence, become successful in her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables, oranges, lemons and cereals such as beans and maize for sale.

loans.name: Mwikali

texts.en: Mwikali is 37 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a retail shop in Kangundo town. She has been in this business for the past 9 years and curently makes a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings. This being her second loan term, she plans to use the money to buy more stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and tea leaves to sell in her retail shop. She will use the generated profits to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to grow her business, make more income and be able to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Nadeed

texts.en:
Nadeed, a 40-year-old housewife and mother of five, lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a tailoring shop, which is the family's only source of income. He has excellent tailoring skills and provides stitching services in his community.

In order to meet customer demand, Nadeed's husband wants to purchase one more tailoring machine, so she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Nadeed hopes to start a small business with the new resulting profits. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a stitching machine for her husband's business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 34 years old, single, and has 1 child. She has a boutique business in Nairobi town, where she sells clothing for men, women and children, including suits, trousers, skirts and dresses. She has been in this business for 12 years and it has been profitable. This will be her second loan term, and she plans to use the money to buy more stock of clothes to sell, including trousers, shirts and blouses. She will use the anticipated income to buy more varieties of clothes for sale. She hopes to grow her business by opening more boutiques, and thereby to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 37 years old and married with 4 children. He runs a retail shop in Nairobi town. He has been in this business for the past 3 years and it has been profitable. This will be his third loan term, and he plans to buy more stock of goods to sell. These include milk, sugar, rice and maize flour. He will use the anticipated profits to buy still more goods for sale. He hopes to expand his retail business and become a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy more retail goods for sale.

loans.name: Sicily

texts.en: Sicily is 31 years old and a single mother of 1 child. She sells and supplies polythene bags in Nairobi town and has been in this business for the past 3 years. This will be her third loan term and she plans to use the money to buy more stock of polythene bags to sell. She will use the generated profits to buy still more stock of polythene bags for sale. She hopes to open a retail shop, make more income, and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of polythene bags for sale.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia is 52 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods to sell. Letecia has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, candies, snack foods, laundry soap, etc. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Dieb's Group

texts.en: Dieb is a 60-year-old widowed mother of five children. Originally from the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, she supports her family via rice farming on six hectares. This is the only business that she has had for 20 years. Her previous loan was her first loan with Kiva partner VisionFund, which she has completely repaid. She manages to support the needs of her family on time and improve her livelihood at a good pace. Now, she is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her portion to buy gasoline for a hand-tractor to plow her farmland. She hopes that she can plant her crop seasonably and make a good yield with high income.

loans.use: To buy gasoline for a hand-tractor to plow her farmland

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is 19 years old single man, living in Taiz, Yemen.  He has been operates an accessories store selling perfumes, cosmetic materials, etc. 

His father was the owner of store but decided to hand over his store to his son.  Adnan collected a good amount of working capital to expand his business.  He attributes its success to his being nice to his customers and selling quality goods at affordable prices. 

Adnan requests a youth loan of 400,000 YER from AMB to buy more supplies like perfumes, cosmetic materials, sewing materials etc. This improvement will enable him to increase his income. 

He hopes to open more than one accessories store and attain a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more supplies like  perfumes, cosmetic materials, sewing materials etc.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 48 years old woman who lives in Lahore, Pakistan.  She is a responsible mother of four children. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days his rickshaw has not working properly and he is unable to generate any amount income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible.  However due to the lack of money he unable to repair his rickshaw. 

Therefore Parveen has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. This will help him continue his business. Parveen is so very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to repair rickshaw.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is 53 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and three children. Nusrat, as a member of three person lending group, has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase accessories for her husband’s shop.

Nusrat wants the financing to buy supplies/accessories like cell phone batteries, chargers, casings, head phones, cell phone bags, etc. for her husband’s cell phone accessories shop.  As this shop is the only source of income for their family, she wants to expand it through this financing and make her life happy. 

Her husband is very experienced and professional in his dealings and has been operating his business for the past four years.  Nusrat is confident that the loan will greatly contribute towards a substantial increase in their monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase supplies/accessories like cell phone batteries, chargers, casings, head phones, cell phone bags, etc.

loans.name: Sarun's Group

texts.en: Sarun, a parent of seven children, is a resident of Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To sustain her family, she practices rice farming and pineapple planting as her main business to generate income. With her current business, she is able to earn up to 30,000 KHR per day.  Having completely repaid her previous two loans, she feels confident that she can improve her living condition at a good pace. She is now leading a group of three to apply for a new loan. She plans to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farm. She hopes that this purchase will boost her crop output and triple her yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is a hard worker who manages three businesses: a variety store, rice/corn farm and a piggery, within their locality. 

She is married with three children and an adopted child.  Leticia would like to have more grocery items to sell but her capital is not sufficient due to the bigger expenditures incurred through farming and managing her piggery. 

Leticia decided to request additional capital of PHP50,000 to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, biscuits and various kinds of soap to restock in her variety store. 

She knows that with enough product offerings in the store, she could earn a greater income and this will help her meet the growing needs of her family and eventually improved their living conditions.

Leticia hopes that her requested amount of loan will be granted so she could secure her family's future and educate all of her children.

loans.use: to buy grocery items.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 33 year old single man who describes himself as trustworthy and humble. He supplies and sells milk.  His business is located in a market area and his primary customers are local shops.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient clean water for consumption. 

John will use the Kes 40,000 loan to purchase a water dispenser.  His business goal is to supply milk to major towns within five years. This is his second application of loan with SMEP DTM. The first being kes 20,000 that he repaid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase a water dispenser.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en: Riffat is a 47 year old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a tailoring shop which is the only source of income for the family. He has excellent tailoring skills and he provides stitching services in his community. He wants to purchase one more sewing machine so that he can keep up with the demands of customers. However, due to a lack of funds he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife Riffat has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband. Riffat wants to start a small business with the profits earned. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is 44 years old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan and is a responsible mother of four children. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession.  His rickshaw is not working properly and he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. 

Therefore, Razia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband repair his rickshaw.  This will help him continue his business. 

Razia is so much thankful to kiva.

loans.use: to repair rickshaw.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 41 years-old married Iraqi man with four children, for whom he works hard to educate and provide for.

Ali owns a small shop where he sells cereals, grains, sugar and flour.  He is a wholesaler and a retailer.  Ali is very well known in the market since he is the only person who provides all the area with this variety of goods.  He established his business in 1992 and has an employee. Ali gained good experience in this field.

Ali is requesting a loan of $2,000 to install a new display window for his shop.  He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to continue educating his children so that when the grow and graduate, they may have good careers.

loans.use: to install a new display window for his shop.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 40 years of age and married.  To support her family, she runs a retail store in the village of Guam.  She has been in business for almost a year and earns about PHP300 a day. 

To grow her retailing, she is requesting a loan of PHP15,000 to buy groceries such as curls, soft drinks, canned goods, and noodles to sell. 

Dolores hopes to increase her business incomes to better feed her family and somehow be a success in the business.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as curls, soft drinks, canned goods, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Barid

texts.en:
Barid is a married man, 29 years old, who has a child.  He is a hard work who lives in a poor area with his family in Hodeida, Yemen. 

He collected a small amount of money to buy a motorbike transportation service to cover his daily expenses.  

So, Barid is requesting a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB.  He will use the loan to buy a motorbike. 

He wants to expand his business, in the future.  Barid hopes to own a bus, to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Rahat

texts.en:
Rahat, age 30, is a housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. He runs a machinery repair shop, which is the only source of income for the family. They belong to a poor family and are working to survive their lives with so many hurdles and challenges.

Presently Rahat’s husband needs to purchase spare parts for his shop. For that Rahat is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. He will use the loan to purchase a variety of spare parts for reparing machines. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. Rahat hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for repairing machines.

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en:
For more than 24 years Nadir has been engaged in farming and selling wheat and barley.  His wife is his assistant in all matters.  They have two children, 25 and 18 years of age. 

Nadir is a pensioner.  His wife works as a teacher and receives a salary of AZN 250.

Nadir has a hernia. The pain makes it hard to walk and that is why he needs emergency surgery. 

To cover all hospital costs, Nadir has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,500 AZN.

loans.use: To cover hospital costs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive con sus padres y hermanos en casa propia, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maíz y el frijol sus productos los comercializa en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos de la casa, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cosechas como: semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicida, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde desea hacer la siembra, y asi poder seguir ayudando a su familia sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: The borrower lives with his parents and siblings in their own house. He has worked in agriculture for a number of years. His main planting is corn and beans. He sells his products in the various markets that are near his place of residence. With the earnings that he obtains he helps with the household expenses. The borrower is applying for a loan to be able to purchase the necessary supplies for his crops, such as seeds, fertilizers, compost, herbicides, etc., and to improve the land where he wants to do the planting, and thus to be able to continue helping his family without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy seeds fertilizers, compost, herbicides, etc., and to improve the land

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion is 57 years old and married with 2 children.  Raising hogs is the primary income source for Salvacion and her family.  This has been her business for five months.  She wanted to have more pigs to raise but she lacks the necessary capital.  In this regard, Salvacion is asking for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy piglets and a sufficient supply of hog feed.  Salvacion hopes that she can get the amount requested to develop her business further.

loans.use: to buy piglets and a sufficient supply of hog feed.

loans.name: Emildy

texts.en: Emildy is 47 years old and married with 4 children, one of whom is in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Emildy has a fishing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 15 years.  She requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.  In the future, Emildy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Vafadar

texts.en:
Vafadar is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Fizuli city, where he lives with his family.  He is 42 years old, married, and has two daughters.  He is the only one earning an income, as his wife stays at home.  One of his daughters helps him at work and the other attends school.  Vafadar started his business of raising and selling calves 7 years ago.  Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to make a new stall for the calves.  In the future, Vafadar wants to get more calves for his new stall.  He wants to use his earnings for his wife's future medication and his daughters' future.  

Vafadar is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to make a new stall for his calves.

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es: El señor Jaime de 31 años de edad  vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en  de una  de las comunidad rurales de Matagalpa. Actualmente tiene un terreno propio donde  construyó su humilde vivienda. El trabaja en una de las  fincas de la zona,donde le dan su alimentacion del dia. El lleva la cena a su casa  para compartirla con con su  familia . El siempre ha trabajado en las fincas donde cotiza seguro social. Este seguro para él es importante ya que así su familia   pueden recibir atención médica. A él  le gustaría que en su casa hubiera luz pero la unica manera es recibiendo un credito y comprar un pequeño sistema solar de un panel con dos luminarias por que en su  comunidad no hay luz eléctrica. Al obtener este sistema él  podra alumbrarse en su puequeña y humilde casa con su familia.  Actualmente se ilumina en su  casa con candelas y piensa que es  peligro para sus  hijos por algun incendio. Jaime  estaria agradecido  por recibir la oportunidad de llevar energia limpia a su hogar donde su familia podra tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jaime is 31 years old and he lives with his wife and his two children in a rural community in Matagalpa. He currently has his own piece of land where he built his humble home. 

He works on one of the farms in the area where they give him food daily. He brings his dinner to his house to share it with his family. He has always worked on the farms he contributes to social security. This is important to him because it allows his family to receive medical attention. 

He would like to have electricity in his house but the only way to do so is to get a loan and purchase a small solar panel energy system with two lights because there is no electricity in his community. Upon getting this system he will be able to light his small and humble home with his family. Right now they light the house with candles and he thinks this is dangerous for his children in the case of a fire. 

Jaime would be grateful to receive this opportunity to bring clean energy to his home where his family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system for his home.

loans.name: Felipe Santiago

texts.es: Felipe de 56 años de edad se dedica  a la  agricultura desde hace varios años, siembra los principales granos básicos maíz, frijol y maicillo, vende sus productos en las diferentes agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cinco hijos, don Felipe esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un préstamo para poder comprar abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde siembra ya que el lugar donde el reside los terrenos son rusticos y pedregosos y asi poder seguir con su siembra y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Felipe, who is 56 years old, has worked in agriculture for a number of years. He plants the principal basic grains, corn, beans, and sorghum. He sells his products to the various agencies that buy and sell basic grains. With the earnings that he obtains, he manages to cover some household expenses. He lives in his own house with his wife and their five children. Don Felipe is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to be able to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, etc., and to improve the land where he plants, since in the place where he lives the land is rustic and stony, and thus be able to continue with his planting and give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, etc., and to improve the land

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane has been selling clothing in one of the city markets for three years. She lives in Vanadzor town with her mother-in-law and 13-year-old daughter. Due to her kind attitude towards people, Gayane has gained many loyal customers over these years. In order to meet current demand and stay competitive in the market, Gayane needs to purchase supplies for her shop. As the family's only breadwinner, it is very difficult for Gayane to sustain the family's living and at the same time cover her shop's operating costs. So now this hard working woman is requesting this loan to purchase the supplies she needs for her shop.
Gayane has many plans for enlarging her store and she hopes that this loan is a good motivation for her to reach her goals.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for the store

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is a 58-year-old married woman and a mother of six children.  She adores her family.  Her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life.  Her husband owns a clothing business which is the only source of income for his family.  He purchases a variety of clothes from factories and sells them at a profitable price.

Shamim is a member of a 2-person lending group and has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband.  He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of clothing so that he can respond quickly to customers’ needs.  He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns.  Shamim hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business.  Her house is in very bad condition, so she wants to use the profits to maintain his house.  She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en: Jovelyn is 46 years old and married with four children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines.  Jovelyn is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.  She has been farming rice for twenty-eight years.  She also earns additional income from food vending.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 53 years old and married with one child.  She works very hard to provide for the two of them.  Liezel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan, through NWTF, in order to purchase more groceries to sell.  Liezel has been in this business for twenty-one years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Liezel would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rwina Group

texts.en: This group is called Rwina and consists of four ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. Wadad, one of the members, is 24 years old. She complains of a lack of means of getting more money to expand her house in which she wants to live a more comfortable life. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER to buy construction supplies for her house. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Natavan

texts.en:
Natavan is 37 years old and a mother of 2 sons.  She is an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives with her husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  She has dedicated 12 years of her life to agriculture.  Natavan usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then sells them for profit in the livestock bazaar.  Her monthly income is 100 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income for her family.  Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma.  Natavan also keeps dairy cows for personal use and for sale to her neighbors. 

Natavan has already taken 3 loans from Aqroinvest in the past.  With a good loan history, she has applied for a 4th loan (1,600 AZN) in order to purchase three cattle and one dairy cow.  With this money, she wants to expand her business and improve her family’s life conditions.  Natavan awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase 3 cattle and one dairy cow.

loans.name: Ziyarat

texts.en:
Ziyarat is 30 years old with two daughters. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with his wife in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  He is growing fruits and vegetables. He plants tomatoes, potatoes, eggplants and other vegetables and fruits. He says, even though this business is very hard, together with his wife he has been handling the business for 10 years without any difficulty. 
Ziyarat grows vegetables and fruits and sells them in the bazaar. His income from vegetable and fruit sales is 90 AZN. He has more plans for the future, such as to get more land for cultivation.  He is looking forward to increased sales in the coming summer, because people purchase more fruits at that time. Nowadays he needs a loan of 2000 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of getting new fertilizers and seeds. It will help him to grow more fruit and vegetables in order to get more revenue in the coming summer, which will help him to support his family’s needs. He has a good loan history. This is his 4th loan.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Remedios works hard to support her family. She has a salted sea foods business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from jeepney transport. Remedios is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to buy fish and other ingredients for her business.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past 45 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fish and other ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 56 years old and married.  She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines.  Marissa requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and a variety of seedlings for her vegetable farm.  Marissa has been farming vegetables for twelve years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and a variety of seedlings for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Isidro Alberto

texts.es: Isidro es un señor  de 34 años de edad. El vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en un caserío de una comunidad rural en Matagalpa. Actualmente tiene un terreno  pequeño y ahí construyó su humilde casa para darles  un techo  a su familia. El trabaja en una finca donde  le dan  su alimentación los tres tiempos.El siempre ha trabajado en  finca en los labores de mantenimiento. Dos de  sus hijos van a clases y la otra  hija  se queda en la casa con su  mamá. A don Isidro le gustaría que en su casa hubiera luz pero la única manera es recibiendo un crédito para  comprar un sistema solar , porque en esa comunidad no hay luz eléctrica. El solicita un pequeño crédito para comprar un panel pequeño de dos luminarias para alumbrarse  en su pequeña y humilde vivienda. Actualmente en su hogar se   alumbran   con candelas. El piensa  que es muy peligroso  para sus hijos continuar con las candelas por algún incendio que pueda originarse. Al tener el pequeño sistema solar sus hijos  podrían hacer  tareas por las noches. Isidro estaría muy agradecido  y emocionado si le  dieran esta oportunidad que sin duda beneficiará su  hogar.
texts.en:
Isidro is a 34-year-old man. He lives with his wife and three children in a small neighborhood of a rural village in Matagalpa. Currently, he has a small piece of land where he built a humble home to put a roof over his family. He works on a farm where they feed him three times a day. He has always worked on farms doing maintenance work. Two of his children go to school and his daughter stays at home with her mom. 

Isidro would like to his home to have electricity but the only way to do so is by getting a loan to buy a solar home system because there is no electricity in that community. He is requesting a small loan to buy a small solar panel with two lamps to light his small and humble home. Right now he lights his home with candles. He thinks this is very dangerous for his children to continue using candles as a fire could start. With a small solar home system his children can do their homework at night. 

Isidro would be very grateful and excited if given this opportunity that will doubtless be beneficial for his home.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system so as to have light in his home.

loans.name: Arlette Nikko

texts.en:
Arlette Nikko is a fresh graduate student of criminology.  She is 22 years old and still single.  While searching for a job, she helps her mother to manage their hog-raising business.

She is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy feed for her hogs.  At present, she is gradually learning the business so that if she is ever unable to find a good job she will just focus on running the business well.  She hopes to contribute towards the success of her family livestock business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Susime

texts.en:
Susime is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a Transient Vendor business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fish, shrimp and other packaging products for her Transient Vendor business.

Susime successfully paid back her previous loan and is getting a new loan in order to build and expand her business.

NWTF is re-listing Susime's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp and other packaging products for her business.

loans.name: Queeny Lyn

texts.en:
Queeny Lyn is 21 years old and married with one child.  She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines.  Queeny Lyn is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Queeny Lyn has been farming vegetables for two years and she also earns additional income from e-loading (prepaid mobile load).  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cristeta

texts.en:
Cristeta is 61 years old and widowed with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. Cristeta runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, sugar, milk and canned goods.

Cristeta has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from selling meat. In the future Cristeta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, sugar, milk and canned goods

loans.name: Asiya's Group

texts.en: Asiya is a 36-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Her husband owns and runs a fruit shop in the market which is the family's only source of income. He sells apples, bananas and oranges in his shop. He is interested in offering more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However due to the lack of income he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife Asiya, as a member of a three person group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at profitable price. With the profit her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Asiya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en:
Elvina is a 23-year-old married woman and mother of two children. Elvina  is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with her husband in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a Fuzulu refugee. She has dedicated four years of her life to agriculture. She plants tomatoes, potatoes, eggplants and other vegetables and fruits. Her income from vegetable and fruit sales is 90 AZN. She has more plans for future, such as to get more land for cultivation. She is looking forward to increased sales in the coming summer, because people purchase more fruits at that time.
She has applied for a loan of 2000 AZN from Aqroinvest. This loan is for the purpose of getting new fertilizers and seeds. It will help her to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to get more revenue in the coming summer which will help her to support her family’s needs. Elvina awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Levy

texts.en: Levy works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a turmeric tea manufacturing business in the Philippines.  Levy requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of raw materials for her business.  Levy has been in this business for 5 years now.  In the future, Levy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her turmeric tea business.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo is a farmer. He works daily in his farm with his strong desire to improve his crop production. He works full time in the maintenance of his farming business. He is 35 years old and is now widowed. He works hard to lift his family living out of poverty and to give his two children a better education. 

Due to the high cost of basic commodities and farm inputs, Marcelo is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 in order to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to increase his profits so that he can sustain the financial needs of his children and save money for the future. Marcelo believes that through his patience in managing his business, he will be able to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizer to improve and increase his farm production

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 37 years old and lives in a small city, Gavar, in the Gegharkunik region.  Aida is a widow with two sons, both of whom are in the Russian Federation working abroad.  She lives alone and has never worked.  Recently, she owned a small shop where she sells flowers and organizes mourning ceremonies.  The income is not very good, but she manages to cover the stall rental and to earn some savings.

Aida requests a loan to buy flowers and materials for making bouquets.

loans.use: to buy flowers and materials for making bouquets.

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en:
Sonya is a very respected and nice lady who has become the loyal and very responsible client of both Nor Horizon and Kiva. She lives in Yerevan. She has already had numerous loans from Nor Horizon and this is the fifth one from Kiva. She is still engaged in the clothes trading business (women's clothes, underwear and swimsuits) in the Yerevan trade market in a rented stall. She is a very charming and educated woman. For many years she worked at the school as a teacher of mathematics, and the trading business was something very new for her, but the desire to help her son and lighten his family’s financial problems made her get used to this work also.
Sonya asks for a loan of 2000 US dollars to buy a lot of summer season women's dresses and of course swimsuits, which she manages to sell so successfully.

loans.use: to buy a large number of dresses and swimsuits to sell.

loans.name: Nizar

texts.en:
Nizar is a 34-year-old married man from Jabalia city.  He lives in a quiet neighborhood with his wife and two young kids, a boy and a girl.  Nizar works as an employee in the public sector and earns a low income, which is barely enough to cover the family’s needs.  He also works as a chef in an Eastern-dining restaurant.  It is a very profitable job which is now increasing due to wedding parties in the summer. 

Nizar took a USD loan from FATEN.  He would like to develop his business by buying cooking tools such as large pots and an oven.  This will help him to increase his working capacity and also to increase his income.  Nizar appears in the photo while he was cooking for a wedding party.

loans.use: to buy cooking tools for his restaurant.

loans.name: Larry

texts.en:
Larry has lived in Lubbock, Texas, all his life and has been in the vending machine business for more than 17 years.  He and his wife operate L&L Vending, supplying local businesses with candy and toy vending dispensing machines.
