Larry began searching for ways to purchase additional machines to increase his revenue.  He visited Wells Fargo Bank and was later referred to Accion Texas Inc. for a microloan. He applied and shortly after received approval for a $5,450 loan.  Larry began purchasing additional vending machines to grow his business and presence in the Lubbock market.
  
As of now they are the only employees of L&L Vending, but plan to hire additional employees in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional vending machines

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
Walaa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Walaa is a 22-year-old married woman. She lives in a simple house with her husband and two young daughters in a small neighborhood in Jabalia. Walaa's husband works in a barber shop he owns and this is the only source of income for the family.

Walaa is still a university student. She studies social service so she will work in any school as a social worker and help her husband with part of the family expenses.

Walaa took a Murabaha Loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. She will be able to do her homework and reports very easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her schoolwork

loans.name: Camino Al Progreso  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Camino al Progreso está formado por 7 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, desde este lugar hay una hermosa vista de la ciudad de Cuenca por lo que es conocido como el mirador de la ciudad, su geografía es accidentada, con bellos paisajes y verdes campos. Su gente es amable, gentil y muy carismática que todos los días buscan la manera de mejorar su estabilidad económica de sus hogares para brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, la crianza de animales y algunos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes fuentes de trabajo.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Rosa, se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Camino al Progreso, grupo que le gusta mucho ya que comparte buenos momentos con sus vecinas, sale de la rutina de su trabajo y a la vez aprende con las charlas de educación que reciben.

La Señora. María Rosa tiene 43 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 23, 21, 18, 15 y 12 años de edad, su primera hija trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segundo hijo ya es casado y vive independiente, sus dos siguientes hijos trabajan pero solo para los gastos personales y su último hijo pasa en casa. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que vive  propia.

Doña María Rosa se dedica a la agricultura, lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su casa y el sobrante lo vende, también cría pollos, cerdos y cuyes. 

Su crédito va a invertir para la compra de pollos, cuyes y materiales de construcción para hacer un galpón de pollos más grande.

Su meta es crecer en su negocio de la crianza de animales.

La foto pequeña es de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The loan group "Camino al Progreso" (Road to Progress) was formed by seven women who live on the outskirts of the Turi parish in Cuenca. From this place there is a beautiful view of the city of Cuenca. For this reason it is known as the viewpoint of the city. Its geography is rugged, with beautiful landscapes and green fields. Its people are friendly, gracious, and very charismatic, and every day they look for ways to improve the economic stability of their households in order to offer a better future to their children. Their principal economic activity is agriculture and raising animals, and some work in the city in various workplaces.

One of the members of this group is Señora Maria Rosa, who is now in her third loan cycle, along with her friends and fellow group members from Camino al Progreso, a group that she likes a lot, since she shares good moments with her neighbors, leaves the routine of her work, and at the same time learns from the educational talks that they receive.

Señora Maria Rosa is 43 years old. She is married, and she and her husband have five children, ages 23, 21, 18, 15, and 12. Her oldest, a daughter, works and helps her economically. Her second child, a son, is married and lives independently. Her next two children work but only for their personal expenses, and her last son lives at home. Her husband works as a bricklayer. The house where they live is their own.

Doña Maria Rosa works in agriculture. What she harvests is for the household consumption, and she sells what is left. She also raises chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs.

She is going to invest her loan in the purchase of chickens, guinea pigs, and construction materials to make a bigger chicken coop.

Her goal is to grow in her animal-raising business.

The little photo is of two members who were not able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and construction materials

loans.name: Lonie

texts.en:
Lonie is 52 years old and married with one child in school. Lonie works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, egg, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

Lonie has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Lonie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, egg, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Ayvaz

texts.en:
Ayvaz has been involved in agriculture for 25 years. Over these years of hard work Ayvaz currently runs a beautiful and profitable farm. He lives with his son and wife who run the farming business with him. Currently Ayvaz keeps on his farm 2 cows, 34 sheep, and 20 chickens. The family also owns a plot of land where different types of trees are cultivated (peach, apricot, apple, nut and pear).

Together with agriculture, Ayvaz also works as a driver, but unfortunately the salary he gets is hardly enough for covering basic needs. Ayvaz sells the gathered agricultural products in the local market and earns income which is vital for covering the family's daily needs. So, realizing that agriculture is very important for him, Ayvaz would like to enlarge his farm. Now, with a good credit history behind him, Ayvaz is requesting this loan. With the loan's help he plans to purchase 2 oxen and 5 pigs and he hopes that this will significantly improve his farm and will increase his income.

Ayvaz does his best to improve his family's living conditions and ensure a better life for his son and wife.

loans.use: to pay for 2 oxen and 5 pigs

location.town: Gndevaz village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 49-year-old married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 9 years to 26 years. He describes himself to be honest and humble. He operates a wholesale business where he sells soft drinks. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a shopping area and his primary customers are retail shops. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital to finance his business. He will use the 50,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to add more soft drinks to his wholesale business. This is his second application for a loan with SMEP DTM. The previous was for 20,000 KES which he repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add more soft drinks to his wholesale business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 62 years old and lives in the village of San Pedro with her three children. She is now widowed.  Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in farming for over 30 years and earns approximately 30,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every season. She also sells vegetables in the local community to have an extra source of income. She needed additional capital to sustain her farming yield to support her family's immediate needs. She would like to request a loan in the amount of 18,000 PHP to purchase seeds, insecticides, and fertilizers needed in the maintenance of her farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, and fertilizers

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 33 years old and married with four children.

Letecia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, coffee, milk, snack foods, soft-drinks and other groceries in her general store.

Letecia has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

Letecia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, coffee, milk, snack foods, soft-drinks and other groceries in her general store

loans.name: Rani

texts.en: Rani is a 41-year-old woman who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 6 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, so he has been unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Rani has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Rani is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw

loans.name: Dolores Emperatriz

texts.es:
La Señora Dolores se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el grupo de crédito Sector 3 Marías, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, lugar que goza de verdes campos por su geografía accidentada. Su gente es luchadora y muy trabajadora, laboran en diferentes actividades como es la agricultura, crianza de animales y comercio, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Dolores tiene 40 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 21, 19 y 17 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive  independiente, sus dos hijos siguientes estudian y trabajan. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.

Doña Dolores labora como empleada domestica medio día desde hace algunos años, en su casa a mas de dedicarse a su familia cría pollos y cuyes.

Su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para sus animales.

Su meta es tener más galpones de pollos para crecer en este negocio.
texts.en:
This is Ms. Dolores’s second loan with the credit group Sector 3 Marías. She lives around the parish of Turi in Cuenca, an area that is rich in green fields because of its rugged terrain. The people struggle and are very hardworking. They work in various activities, such as agriculture, sales, and raising animals. They also maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

Ms. Dolores is 40 years old. She is a single mother of three children, ages 21, 19, and 17. Her eldest daughter is married and lives independently. Her younger two children study and work. She does not have her own house, so they live in a relative’s house.

Ms. Dolores has worked as a part time domestic employee for some years. She also raises chickens and guinea pigs in her house, in addition to caring for her family. 

She is going to use her new loan to buy chickens and food for the animals.

Her goal is to have more chicken sheds in order to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and food for the animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goods for his business.

loans.name: Chinacual Group

texts.es:
El señor Javier esta casado, tiene 49 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos y de ellos 1 está estudiando, se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente siembra maíz y café, inició este negocio por la necesidad de generar ingresos económicos para el mantenimiento de su familia y hasta la fecha lleva 30 largos años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de insumos para agricultura tles como: semillas, fertilizantes entre otros, en el futuro espera contar con mejores y abundantes cosechas. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la agricultura. En la fotografía aparecen 6 integrantes pero solamente a 5 se le concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Javier is a married 49 year old. He never had the opportunity to obtain an education. He has 5 children and one of them is studying. He is a farmer, more specifically, he grows corn and coffee. He began this business because of the necessity of obtaining an income in order to support his family and he has 30 long years of experience to date.

He is organizing a group in order to be able to request a loan that he will use for the purchase of agricultural supplies, such as seed, fertilizer, etc. In the future he hopes to be able to count on better and more abundant harvests. The other members of the group work in agriculture. In the photograph there are 6 members but only 5 have been granted the loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for farming

loans.name: Lucinda Magaly

texts.es:
La Señora. Lucinda es una muy buena socia que se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Sector 3 Marías, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, lugar que goza de verdes campos por su geografía accidentada. Su gente es luchadora y muy trabajadora, laboran en diferentes actividades como es la agricultura, crianza de animales y comercio, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La señora Lucinda tiene 23 años, es casada y aun no tiene hijos. Su esposo labora en la área de la construcción como albañil.

Doña Lucinda tiene un pequeño taller de costura desde hace un año y medio, por el momento le va muy bien en el negocio y cada vez va creciendo, trabaja todos los días sin un horario fijo.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a  invertir en la compra de telas, hilos y otros materiales para la costura.

Su sueño es tener su local para vender la ropa que confecciona
texts.en:
Ms. Lucinda is a very good member of the credit group Sector 3 Marías. This is the second loan she has done with her friends and partners in this group. She lives on the outskirts of the parish of Turi in Cuenca, an area rich in green fields because of its rugged terrain. Its people struggle and are very hardworking. They work in various activities, such as agriculture, sales, and raising animals. They also maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

Ms. Lucinda is 23 years old. She is married but still has no children. Her spouse works in construction as a bricklayer.

Ms. Lucinda has had a small sewing shop for a year and a half. The business is going very well for now and is always growing. She works every day but has no fixed schedule. 

Ms. Lucinda is going to use the money from this loan to buy fabric, thread, and other materials for sewing. 

Her dream is to have her own shop to sell the clothing that she makes.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and other materials for sewing.

loans.name: Hien's Group

texts.en:
Hien is 27 years old. She has three children who are learning at primary school and at kindergarten. Her husband is a driver to earn a living and earns about 6,000,000VND (Vietnamese dong) per month. Hien sells clothes in a market. Hien earns about 6,000,000VND per month. She has done this job for six years. Her family’s total earnings are 12,000,000VND per month.

 Her challenge in life and work is lacking capital to buy more clothes to expand her business. Her dream is to open her own clothes shop. This loan is one of the steps that helps her reach this dream. She will have money to pay her children’s education fee and can enlarge her business.

Hien is a hardworking woman. This is the first time she participates in SEDA’s microfinance program. In the first loan cycle, she wants to borrow 5,152,000VND to buy more clothes to expand her business. She wants to gain earnings and save profit to grow her children up well.

Other members who are part of Hien’s group include the following:

Lan is 25 years old. She has two children. She sells building materials. She wants to borrow 6,944,000VND to invest in her business.

Sau is 26 years old. She has two children. She sells tea and beverages. She wants to borrow 6,944,000VND to invest in her beverage stall.

Van is 52 years old. She has three children. She sells tea and beverages. She wants to borrow 5,152,000VND to invest in her beverage stall.

Lan is 34 years old. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 8,288,000VND to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to expand her business.

loans.name: Odontsatsral

texts.en:
Mrs. Odontsatsral, 26 years old, lives with her husband in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. They live in their own house on a plot of land. She has been working as a saleswoman at a grocery store since 2010. Her husband has a position at a military base. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,800,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, planks, cement, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, she and her husband can make their house more comfortable and a warmer place. More importantly, they will begin to burn less coal for heating and it has a positive impact on the environment as less carbon dioxide is emitted into the air. The borrower is a very hardworking woman who also grows vegetables in spring for a living.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is 55 years old. She has two children are married. Her husband breeds pigs to earn a living. He earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. Hue cooks food to sell in a market. She has done this job for four years. She gains 5,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is the lack of capital to enlarge her family’s breeding farm. Her dream is to repair her house on a higher and drier floor and to open a grocery store. This loan helps her get to this dream. She can buy more pigs to breed to gain earnings and save the profit for her dream. Hue is a hardworking and careful woman.

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,288,000 VND to buy more pigs to breed. She always wants to repair her house and open a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to breed.

loans.name: Sabit

texts.en:
Sabit is a 26-year-old customer and father of three children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and kids in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Sabit is a Jabrayili refugee. He is very kind, caring and very energetic in his work. Sabit raises cattle, fattens them and sells them for a profitable price. His wife is the major support for him in this business.

He sells meat at the central bazaar for a profit. In Azerbaijan, there is a high demand for meat because it is used in a lot of meals, such as kufta (soup), kebabs, dolma etc. His income from this business is 180 AZN per month. In order to fully support the family, Sabit is looking forward to expanding the business and making it very successful.
. 
He has applied for his third loan of 1500 AZN from Aqroinvest, to buy three calves. Sabit, at this very young age and with a great passion and energy, plans to become a successful businessman in the town.

loans.use: to buy three calves

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en:
Elvin is 29 years old and a father of two children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Jabrayil and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Elvin has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than five years now. He is very hard working and passionate in his   work. He considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes, and cucumbers and plant fruit trees with his wife. He sells his crops in the central bazaar to make a profit in order to support his family.
 
Elvin's income from this business is 100 AZN a month. In order to improve the living conditions of his family, he plans to expand his business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. He believes in the near future he will grow the business. Since the vegetable and fruit business is profitable and a fun business, he wants the business to continue and prosper.

He has applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN at Aqroinvest. This loan is for the purpose of getting new fertilizers and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to get more revenue in the coming summer, which will help him to support his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en: Sobia, age 30, is a very hardworking housewife. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband offers sheltering services. Sobia is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan to purchase bamboo, nails, and iron sheets for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. Sobia hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, nails, and iron sheets

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is a 45-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the last many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly and because of this, he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Sajida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his work and generate income. Sajida is so very thankful for Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw

loans.name: Mario Javier

texts.es: Mario Javier de 46 años de edad casado con dos hijos aun menores de edad del domicilio de Chinandega, el se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable con ganas de superación personal en sus ratos libre a el le gusta disfrutarlo más con su familia haciendo una deliciosa comida y compartir sus inquietudes que puedan tener así es como pasan cuando están todos juntos sin que el trabajo interfiera en su hogar, Mario es propietario de un taller de soldadura el cual brinda servicios de instalación de techos, vergas, portones, maquinaria pesada entre otros, sus clientes son fijos y en ocasiones eventuales, el diario se levanta desde muy temprano para abrir su taller y cierra muy tarde para así bríndales un mejor servicio a sus clientes trabajando aproximadamente más de 10 horas, el objetivo de este crédito es para compra de un activo fijo como es cortadora para realizar trabajos de montajes de maquinaria pesada que las utiliza en empresas, este negocio lo inicia con poco capital, y uno de sus sueños es poder seguir trabajando más para así agrandar el taller.
texts.en:
Mario Javier, 46, is married and has two minor children who still live at home in Chinandega.  He is a hard-working, responsible man who is determined to improve his situation.  In his free time he enjoys spending time with his family making a delicious meal and sharing his concerns about life without work interfering in the household.

Mario owns a welding shop where he offers services such as installing ceilings, beams, doors and heavy machinery, etc.  He has a fixed customer base and some occasional customers.  Every day he gets up very early to open his workshop and closes very late in order to give his customers the best service he can by working over ten hours a day.

The loan he is requesting is to buy a cutting machine, a fixed asset, which he will use when assembling heavy machinery for companies.  He started his business with only a little capital; and one of his goals is to continue working more and more and expand his workshop.

loans.use: To buy a cutting machine to assemble heavy machinery.

loans.name: Rosa Maclovia

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa desde hace algún tiempo forma parte del grupo de crédito Sector 3 Marías, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, lugar que goza de verdes campos por su geografía accidentada. Su gente es luchadora y muy trabajadora, laboran en diferentes actividades como es la agricultura, crianza de animales y comercio, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Rosa tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 20, 17, 16 y 14 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan, le ayudan económicamente y estudian en un colegio a distancia, sus dos últimos hijos solo se dedica a estudiar en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Rosa se dedica a la crianza de animales, a la agricultura y también trabaja en el arreglo de casas, todas estas actividades le permiten tener su independencia económica, a la vez que tiene un espacio para estar con su familia y en especial con sus hijos. 

Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de pollos de los cuales obtuvo muy buenas ganancias. Esta repitiendo el crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de más pollos, alimento para sus animales y semillas para sus cultivos. El grupo de crédito le gusta por las charlas de educación que reciben, la alegría de todas las socias y el compañerismo.
texts.en:
For some time now, Rosa has been a member of the communal bank "Sector 3 Marías".  She lives on the outskirts of the Turi community in Cuenca, which has lush green fields due to its geography.  The locals are hard-working, determined people who run businesses involving agriculture, livestock farming and commerce.  They maintain the culture and traditions of the villages.

Rosa, 40, is married and has four children, ages 20, 17, 16 and 14.  Her eldest two work and help out financially and also study through distance learning.  The youngest two attend school in the city.  Her husband works for a private company and they own their home.

Rosa raises animals, works in agriculture and also works as a domestic employee.  All of these jobs give her economic independence and sometimes she even has time to spend with family, especially her children.

She used her previous loan to buy chickens which have given her a very good profit.  She is requesting another loan to buy more chickens, animal feed and seeds for planting.  She enjoys the communal bank because of the educational talks she receives, the cheerfulness of the other members and the camaraderie.

loans.use: To buy chickens, animal feed and seeds.

loans.name: Norma Maria

texts.es: Doña Norma, habitante del barrio Villa Reconciliación, una zona marginal de Managua su esposo es conductor de buses, ella continua vendiendo con todos los ánimos de salir adelante junto a su familia. El crédito que solicita es para invertir en su negocio con variedades de cosméticos, ropa, calzados para damas y caballeros, para  vender y contar con esos ingresos para los gastos del hogar y de colegio de sus hijos.
texts.en: Norma lives in the neighborhood of Villa Reconciliación, a marginal area of Managua, and her husband is a bus driver.  She continues to sell her products in an effort to get ahead together with her family.  The loan she is requesting is to buy a variety of cosmetics, women's and men's clothing, and shoes to sell so she will have enough income to cover household expenses and pay for school costs for her children.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and women's and men's clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Luchadoras está formado por un grupo de 11 mujeres emprendedoras en búsqueda de mejores oportunidades para salir adelante. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca que es una ciudad muy hermosa que tiene muchos lugares para visitar y una variada gastronomía.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Laura, forma parte del grupo de crédito Mujeres Luchadoras desde hace 6 años, tiempo en el que ha establecido una muy buena amistad con todas sus vecinas y amigas, le gusta mucho este tipo de crédito por la unión de todas las socias ya que son una familia.

La Señora Laura tiene 73 años, es casada y en su unión matrimonial procreo 8 hijos casados que viven independientes. No tienen casa propia por lo que tienen que arrendar, su esposo es mecánico pero por su edad solo trabaja horas.

Doña Laura vende ropa desde hace 31 años, la ropa es americana de segunda mano, vende los fines de semana y en todas las ferias de la ciudad,

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra ropa de segunda mano.

Su sueño es mantener su salud para continuar con su trabajando.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Luchadoras" is comprised of 11 women entrepreneurs who are seeking better opportunities to get ahead.  They live in the city of Cuenca, a beautiful place with many tourist attractions and a varied gastronomy.

One of the members, Laura, has been in the group for six years and has established a good friendship with all her neighbors and friends.  She likes the fact that all the members of the group are united and much like a family.

Laura, 73, is married and has eight independent children who are all married.  She rents the house she lives in and her husband is a mechanic who works only a few hours because of his age.

For 31 years Laura has been selling used American clothing.  She sells on weekends at all the markets in the city.

She plans to use the new loan to buy used clothing.  Her goal is to stay healthy so she can keep working.

loans.use: To buy used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy equipment for her business.

loans.name: Nouritou

texts.fr: Nouritou est revendeuse de céréales et de charbon dans la rue depuis 2007. Afin d’assurer le bien-être de sa famille composée de son mari chauffeur et de ses deux enfants, elle souhaite voir ses ventes s’améliorer. Cela ne peut se faire que grâce à un prêt qui lui offrirait la possibilité d’acheter le stock qui lui manque pour répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Nouritou has been street-selling cereals and firewood since 2007. 

In order to ensure the well-being of her family, which includes her husband, who is a driver, and their two children, Nouritou wishes to see her sales improve.

This is only possible with a loan, which will help her stock up and respond better to the needs of her clients.

loans.use: to buy cereals and firewood

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.fr: Marié et père de 04 enfants Monsieur Ferdinand est  revendeur d’articles de quincaillerie âgé de 35 ans. Il dispose de sa boutique et emploie une personne. Il sollicite son second crédit à WAGES pour acheter d’autres articles de quincaillerie pouvant lui permettre de devenir plus tard un grossiste. Il espère ainsi utiliser le profit qu’il tirera de son commerce pour assurer les études de ses enfants et leur épanouissement.
texts.en:
Married and a father of four children, Ferdinand is 35 years old and sells hardware items for a living. He owns a shop and employs one person. 

He is asking for a second loan with WAGES to purchase additional hardware, which may allow him to become a wholesaler later on. 

He hopes to use his profits to to provide for his children's education and development.

loans.use: to purchase hardware items

loans.name: Gabriel Jaime

texts.es: Gabriel Jaime es un hombre de 28 años de edad, padre de un hijo de 8 meses de nacido  y actualmente es soltero. Actualmente se dedica a la confección, actividad que realiza hace 2 meses, después de haberse capacitado en confección y estampados, con lo cual ha obtenido ingresos para apoyar el sostenimiento de su familia. El crédito que solicita lo desea invertir en la compra de dos máquinas, una fileteadora y una recubridora y comprar insumos (telas, hilos, botones), con el fin de confeccionar un producto de muy buena calidad y venderlo a sus familiares y amigos. Su principal sueño es tener su negocio en un local propio bien ubicado, donde pueda ofrecer sus servicios completos, con estampados actuales y productos bien terminados y de excelente calidad, esto le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos para poder ofrecerle  bienestar y una mejor calidad de vida a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Gabriel Jaime, 28, has an 8-month-old son and is currently single. He has worked in sewing for 2 months after completing his training in dressmaking and patterns. With this work, he has earned an income to support his family. 

He has applied for a loan to invest in the purchase of two sewing machines: an overlocking sewing machine and a covering machine. He will also buy supplies (fabric, thread, and buttons) in order to make very good-quality products to sell to his friends and acquaintances. 

His greatest dream is to have a well-located business property where he can offer his complete services, with current patterns and well-finished products of excellent quality. This will allow him to increase his income to offer a better quality of life and well-being to his young son.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines (an overlocking machine and a covering machine), as well as supplies (fabric, thread, and buttons).

loans.name: Izdehar

texts.en:
Izdehar is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Izdehar is a 33-year-old married woman. She lives in a small village near Tulkarm. This village is very famous for its good agricultural organic crops. Izdehar and her husband work as farmers in a small land they own. They plant seasonal crops and sell them in the local market. Izdehar's husband works also as an employee to cover all the family needs. 

Izdehar took a $3,000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Izdehar and her husband to improve their farm by buying more seeds and seedlings for the summer crops.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and seedlings for the summer crops

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 45-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of eight-children. Her husband owns a welding shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. She belongs to a poor family and her husband has to face many challenges to meet the family's needs, as they have a large family. 

Her husband wants to offer a larger variety of products to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings. However, due to the lack of income he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife Nusrat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase iron sheets for making and welding shelves, boxes and cupboards. She assures to pay back the loan installments on time.

Nusrat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets for making and welding shelves, boxes and cupboards

loans.name: Ulkar

texts.en:
Ulkar is 47 years old. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a hard-working person who takes care of her family by doing business in animal husbandry.  Ulkar grows cattle and raises them to sell meat. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Her husband  supports her  in the business. The business takes a lot of effort, but together they run it successfully. She sells the meat in the central bazaar, where the demand for meat is high. People in Azerbaijan consume meat a lot, because it is used in most dishes. Some traditional meals like kebabs, dolma and others require beef in their preparation. Her profit is 130 AZN monthly. Ulkar is applying for a new loan of 1,900 AZN, in order to expand the business by buying new calves. She plans to grow these calves, fatten them and sell more meat, for the coming traditional holidays, when the demand for beef will increase. This is her 3rd loan.

loans.use: to purchase new calves to expand the business

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah earns a living  through her retail sales of clothing goods to the people in her community in Panglao, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than 2 years now. This is the source of her income. Deborah is asking for a loan to buy more inventory for her clothing sales like shirts, pants, blouses, innerwear and slippers. With this, she will be able to sell more thus increasing her sales and income. Deborah dreams of making her  business a success and a stable source of her income.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her clothing sales like shirts, pants, blouses, innerwear and slippers

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy works hard to support her family. Lucy is married and has a buy and sell handicrafts business in the Philippines.

Lucy requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials like nylon thread, shells, etc. for her business.

Lucy has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Lucy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like nylon thread, shells, etc. for her business

loans.name: Merolin

texts.en:
Merolin is 41 years old, married and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Merolin has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Merolin requested a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory to sell.

Merolin has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Merolin would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to sell

loans.name: Beatriz Eugenia

texts.es: Beatriz Eugenia es una mujer de 50 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos y actualmente vive en unión libre con su pareja. Actualmente se dedica a atender su negocio, una tienda donde vende abarrotes, productos lácteos, carnes frías, mecato, entre otros productos de la canasta familiar; su negocio se encuentra ubicado en una vereda del municipio de Rionegro. La titular es una persona trabajadora y lucha día a día para apoyar el sostenimiento de su hogar y, a pesar  que las ganancias sólo le permiten cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, esto no la detiene para seguir trabajando arduamente. Con el crédito que solicita desea comprar más mercancía (confitería, galletería, productos lácteos, mecato) para surtir su tienda y poder ofrecer variedad a sus clientes y así aumentar las ventas. Su principal sueño es hacer crecer su negocio hasta convertirlo en el más grande de la vereda y mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
Beatriz Eugenia is 50 years old, is in a common law relationship with her partner and has four children. She runs her own small store from which she sells groceries, dairy products, cold meats and packed lunches, among other products that are part of the family shopping basket. Her store is located in a district of the municipality of Rionegro. Beatriz Eugenia is hardworking and fights everyday to provide for her family. Although her profits only cover her family’s basic necessities, she is not deterred from continuing to work hard.

Beatriz Eugenia is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to stock her store, including pastries and sweets, cookies and crackers, dairy products and packed lunches. With these products she will be able to offer a greater variety to her customers and increase her sales. Her principal dream is to grow her business to be the biggest in the district, and to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store, including pastries and sweets, cookies and crackers, dairy products and packed lunches.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en: Abbass is a 36-year-old married man, living in a village in the Bekaa valley with his wife. He is employed in an industry where he is in charge of the general maintenance of the machines, and has been working in this field for 8 years now. His wife is currently unemployed, which makes him the only financial provider of the family. His revenue does not allow him to provide enough care and attention to a potential child, which is why he decided to contact Al Majmoua. In fact, he needs to acquire a loan that would help him purchase construction material which he will be using  in building his house. This will probably allow him and his wife to be able to have children in a better environment. As for the future, Abbas wishes to open up his own business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials which he will use for building his house

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is a married woman. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 23 years to 34 years. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a clothes sales business. Her business is located in an estate. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient clean water for consumption. She will use the 59,085 KES loan to purchase a water dispenser. This is her 3rd application for a loan with SMEP DTM. Previously she borrowed  20,000 KES that she paid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase a water dispenser

loans.name: Tierra De David Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ella es Paubla tiene 51 años de edad, acompañada y  con un hijo menor de edad, su negocio es la venta de leña desde hace 2 años. Vende sus productos en su casa. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año. El crédito lo solicita para invertir en la compra de fletes de leña. Tanya  una mujer que tiene 24 años de edad y su  negocio es la venta de frijoles cocidos y Aura tiene 20 años de edad y su negocio es la crianza y venta de pollos.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three member entrepreneurs. One of the members is Paubla, who is 51 years old, is in a common law relationship and has one young son. Her business is selling firewood from her home, which she has done for two years now. She has been a client of the field partner for one year.

Paubla is requesting a loan to buy shipments of firewood.

Tanya is 24 years old and her business is selling cooked beans. Aura is 20 years old and her business is raising and selling chickens.

loans.use: to buy shipments of firewood.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a 33-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 6-children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past several days his rickshaw has not worked properly and because of this he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Shehnaz is very thankful to kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw

loans.name: Nickly

texts.en:
Nickly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a school supply retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more items like notebooks, bags and other school supplies.

Nickly has been in this business for three years. Nickly earns additional income from raising livestock.

Nickly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items like notebooks, bags and other school supplies

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. Rosemarie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosemarie requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like noodles, canned goods, soap, spices, etc.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like noodles, canned goods, soap, spices, etc.

loans.name: Ramal

texts.en:
Ramal is a 25-year-old young customer, not yet married. .He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his parents in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Ramal is a Fuzulu refugee. He raises cattle, fattens them and sells them for a profitable price. He has been in this business for 5 years. He is very kind, caring and also very energetic in his work. Since high school, Ramal  chose not to study, but to continue the family tradition in this business. This is a very profitable business and he is doing it together with his father.

He sells meet at the central bazaar for profit. In Azerbaijan, there is a high demand for meat, because it is used in a lot of meals, such as kufta (soup), kababs, dolma etc. His income from this business is 140 AZN per month. In order to fully support the family, Ramal is looking forward to expand the business and making it very successful. With a good loan history he has applied for a second loan of 2,000 AZN. With this money he hopes to buy small calves. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy small calves

loans.name: Amran Group

texts.en: This group is called Amran, which consists of 4 ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. Ahlam is the leader of this group. She is an illiterate woman who is 23 years old and lives in Taiz, Yemen. She is the mother of five children. She has made efforts to raise her children well. She applied for a youth loan of 20,000 YER from AMB to buy home appliances for her house. She wants to open a savings account in the bank to improve her family`s living standards.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for her house

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 60 years old and widowed with seven children.

Luisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock like canned goods, snack foods, noodles, eggs, coffee and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Luisa has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an additional income from vegetable vending.

Luisa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock like canned goods, snack foods, noodles, eggs, coffee and other grocery items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 49 years old, from Kahii-Olkalou and married.  He has 3 kids ages 21,16 and 12 years old.

He has a pole transportation business which he has been operating for the last 10 years and he has applied for his third loan of 40,000 KES at KADET LTD., which he intends to use to buy more poles.

In the future, Simon hopes to have the best pole transportation business in the village so as to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more poles and boost business

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en: Aliya is a 26-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 3-children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past several days his rickshaw has not worked properly and because of this he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Aliya has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Aliya is very thankful to kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Magnolia works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling beauty products. Magnolia is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional inventory of vegetables to sell in her vegetables business.

Magnolia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Xalil

texts.en:
Xalil is 33 years old, married and the father of two sons. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Jabrayili refugee. Xalil grows fruits and vegetables. He plants tomatoes, potatoes, eggplants and other vegetables and fruits. He says, even though this business is very hard, together with his wife he has been handling the business for 10 years without any difficulty. 

Xalil grows vegetables and fruits and sells them in the bazaar. His income from vegetable and fruit sales is100 AZN. He has more plans for the future, such as to get more land for cultivation.  Xalil  is looking forward for the increased sales in the coming summer, because people purchase fruit a lot.

Now he needs a loan of 1,600 AZN. This loan is for purpose of getting new fertilizers and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to get more revenue in the coming summer which will help him to support his family’s needs. He has a good loan history, this is his 4th loan.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 37 years old, married and blessed with two children ages 12 and 5. He has an electronic shop in Naivasha which he has operated for the past ten years. He earns an average income of 40,000 KES per month. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD., to enable him to buy electronic items. He plans to expand his business with the anticipated profit.

In the near future, Patrick hopes to own the biggest electronic shop in Naivasha.

loans.use: to buy electronic items

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married mother of 2 children, Elsie works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling oysters in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring and general store businesses. Elsie is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more oysters to sell to customers.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more oysters to sell to customers

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 34 years old, married and has three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Analie is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Analie has been raising pigs for 6 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 49 years old, married to Eunice and they have one child. He sells shoes in Naivasha and he has been in this business for the past 30 years. He earns an average of  25,000 KES per month. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD., after paying his previous loan on time, to enable him to buy more inventory of shoes. He plans to pay school fees with the anticipated profit.

He hopes to be among the the top businessmen in his area in the near future.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa is 44 years old and has seven children. With five children currently in school, Maria Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Maria Teresa has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as bath soap, detergent, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Maria Teresa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosemelita

texts.en:
Rosemelita is 50 years old, married and has 2 children who are in school. Rosemelita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosemelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchse additonal household needs like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, canned goods, etc., to sell.

Rosemelita has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future Rosemelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchse additonal household needs like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, canned goods, etc., to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 35-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife and two children who are still attending school. His wife works as a private teacher in order to supplement the family's income. As for him, he has been working as a bus driver since 2005 transporting customers to their destination wherever it is. Today, he is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., to perform the needed maintenance on his bus on the inside and the outside so as to attract more customers and therefore earn good income. In the future, he is planning to purchase a new bus and hire a part-time employee to work on it so as to increase his profits as well as expand his business.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his bus

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 50 years old and he is married with 5 kids, age 16, 14, 13, 11 and 6 years old.

He sells tree seedlings, a business he has been running for the last 4 years, and he has applied for a 2nd loan of Kshs 20,000 at KADET LTD, which he intends to use for buying more tree seedlings.

In the future, Patrick hopes to own the biggest tree nursery in Gilgil town.

loans.use: To buy more tree seedlings.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling peanut products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and pig fattening. Charles is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy peanuts, ingredients and packaging products for her peanuts.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, ingredients and packaging products for her peanuts.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 41 years of age. He is married and has been blessed with three children. He has been growing rice for almost 30 years. His net income from the last cropping was approximately PHP 20,000. 

He is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm. This will surely be of great help in the development of his yield in the coming harvest season. According to him, rice farming depends upon the applied farm inputs, the climate and on how well the rice field is managed. 

In the future, Wilson aims to provide a better living for his family through farming.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years. She earns more income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables for her buy-and-sell vegetables business to sell in her food stall.

Rica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Melchora is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, salt, etc. for her food production business.

Melchora has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, salt, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik has been involved in beekeeping for 12 years. Over these 12 years she has gained 26 colonies of bees. At the same time Hasmik is engaged in a farming business. Currently she keeps 13 chickens and grows different types of trees (pear, apple, nut, apricot and peach).

Hasmik lives with her husband and two children in the small village of Arpy, which is located in the Vayots Dzor region. As honey is a must-have item for each household in Armenia, beekeeping is a profitable business for sustaining the family. So, in order to meet her clients' demands, Hasmik wants some financial support for purchasing 4 colonies of bees. 

She has applied for this loan for enlarging her business. With the loan's help she plans to purchase 4 colonies of bees, and to buy onion and tomato seeds. Hamik hopes that Kiva lenders will help her to continue her agricultural business and that she will be able to solve some of her family's problems.

loans.use: to pay for 4 colonies of bees and for onion and tomato seeds.

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
A 25 year-old mother of one little kid residing in Kampong Cham province, Rem is a rice grower on a one-hectare area. She is able to earn up to 30,000 KHR per day from the business that she has been with for several years. 

Rem, a first-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is seeking 1,500,000 KHR in order to pay plowing fees and to buy rice seed as well as potash for her farmland. She sincerely believes that she can replant her rice seasonably and have a good yield.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees and to buy rice seed and potash.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Langmet's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ou Rang Ov district, Langmet is 54 years old. She has two children to take care of. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer who has been growing rice and cassava for 34 years. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
  
Langmet is with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Langmet is going to buy fertilizers for her farmland and spend a portion of it on labor fees. She hopes to make healthy rice and cassava to increase her family’s income so as to make their living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Mirabel

texts.en:
Mirabel is 37 years old and married with four children. She earns a living through her pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

Mirabel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Khy

texts.en:
Khy, age 40, lives in Kampong Cham province. She has four children, three of whom still rely on her, as two are in school while the remaining one is too young for schooling.  Khy deals with the daily costs of living via a rice growing business and by working for others for a fee. She has been involved in her current business for 15 years, earning about four USD per day. 

Khy has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two cycles including this loan, and has fully repaid back her first loan. The positive impact of the loan has enabled her to support her living and she could afford to buy a rice husker to support her business. Now, she is seeking a new loan in order to buy potash, and to buy a decent motorbike to support her business. She hopes that she can produce a good yield for her business and sell it at a high price.

loans.use: To buy potash, and to buy a decent motorbike to support her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is 41 years old, married, and has three children. With one child in school, Wilma works very hard to provide for them. Wilma runs a general store in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store. Wilma has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as candies, noodles, canned goods, snack foods, milk and other groceries. In the future, Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Danaya  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  DANAYA  2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Pourè, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec   SANATA MAMOUTOU, 1 ere debout  de la gauche vers la droite , sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte  acheter des intrants, semence, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour  pour l’exploitation de 0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 50.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya 2 group are married women who are, on average, 42 years old with four children each. They all live in traditional families in Pourè, one of the villages of the commune of San (fourth administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Sanata Mamoutou, a member of the group, grows groundnut. In the photo, she is in the standing row, first from the left.

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds, small tools, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate 0.5 hectare (1.23 acre) of land.

After the harvest, she will sell her production to both men and women in her own village and in San. She is expecting to make a profit of 50,000 CFA francs  per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, seeds, small tools, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blocks, iron, cement, and stone.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en: Jovita is recognized as a responsible mother of four children. She is determined to work hard to lift her family from poverty. She is married to Alberto, a farmer in the village of Guam. She is engaged in selling fruit, such as bananas, and vegetables. She plants and harvest bananas and vegetables, and she sells her products in the market. She is applying for a loan of PHP15,000 to finance needed maintenance on their banana and vegetable farm. She believes that, through her patience and sacrifices, she will able improve her business and make it a viable source of income for her family.

loans.use: to finance needed maintenance on her banana and vegetable farm.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Zenaida has been in this business for three years. Zenaida earns additional income from buying and selling whole roasted pigs. Zenaida has been maintaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 28 years old. She lives in Terjola district with her 31-year-old husband Nugzar, her retired parents in-law and two children, 2 and 6. Maia requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but she never had any success. Her loan request was rejected every time, because of her family's low income and poor living conditions. 

Her family owns a vineyard. With the harvested grapes, they make wine and vodka, which are sold at the local markets. Maia’s husband Nugzar is an artisan. He works on house constructions and renovations for private clients to earn a small monthly salary for his family. 

Maia requested loan from Credo to start up a family business. Maia has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to traditional credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With this loan, Maia will purchase milk cows. She will be milking the cows every day to produce dairy products. Maia will sell cheese and yogurt at the local markets and among the villagers to earn an additional income for her family, which will help her to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows.

loans.name: Thanith's Group

texts.en: Thanith is 44 years old, a married mother of one daughter living in a rural village in Sa Ang district, Cambodia. To support her family, Thanith has been selling grocery items in the village for 20 years. The business currently earns her about KHR 17,000 per day. Thanith has been with VisionFund for six cycles and has completely repaid the past loans, which have helped her relieve her family’s burdens and improve her livelihood. Now she is applying for another loan from VisionFund to buy more grocery items to sell. She hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Ouk's Group

texts.en: Ouk is 34 years old, married, and has eight children. Residing in a rural village of the Pursat Province’s Kror Kor district, she and her husband have been farming rice and raising pigs for more than ten years to make a living. The current business earns her about KHR 19,000 per day, and she can save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs. Ouk has been with VisionFund for two cycles, while the other member of her group has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Now Ouk is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more piglets to raise, and she will also use a portion of the loan to pay for plowing the field. She hopes to make more income so as to enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Al-Hana Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Hana and is composed of five women. The president of the group is Fatima. She is 46 years old, married, and has four children. She works selling vegetables and fruits. She lives in Hadramout, Yemen. She will use the loan to buy onions, tomatoes, apples, oranges, and other items for her business and, in this way, will increase her working capital and improve her business. Her reason for applying for this youth loan is a lack of capital. She faces challenges in her business, including increasing her client base, and she will use the profits to improve the quality of life for her family. She hopes to expand her business to a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, apples, oranges, and other items to sell in her business.
